SOCIETY FOR PUBLIC HEALTH EDUCATION INC
NATIONAL FORUM FOR BLACK PUBLIC ADMINISTRATORS INC
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF NURSE PRACTITIONERS IN WOMENS HEALTH INC
Toastmasters International
organization.missionStatement: The mission of a Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills, which in turn foster self-confidence and personal growth.
organization.description: Toastmasters International empowers people to achieve their full potential and realize their dreams.

organization.name: Toastmasters International
organization.missionStatement: The mission of a Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills, which in turn foster self-confidence and personal growth.
organization.description: Toastmasters International empowers people to achieve their full potential and realize their dreams.

organization.name: COUNCIL ON EDUCATION OF THE DEAF DEPARTMENT OF REHABILITATION COLLE
organization.missionStatement: Ensures quality in education of deaf and hard of hearing through professional development standards
organization.description: Promotes quality in preparation of professionals working with deaf and hard of hearing students; accredits university training programs and certifies qualified teachers

organization.name: CAPITOL HILL SUPPORTIVE SERVICES PROGRAM INC
FREE CONGRESS RESEARCH AND EDUCATION FOUNDATION INC
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION ON TEEN FITNESS AND EXCERCISE
organization.missionStatement: To expand and enhance communities, states, and the nation's effort to prevent and reduce obesity through initiatives that seek to build collaborations to develop innovative physical activity and nutrition education programs for youth.
organization.description: Improving the health status of youth and their families by providing physical activity and nutrition education programs involving partnerships and collaborations.

organization.name: The Legislative Studies Institute
organization.missionStatement: The Legislative Studies Institute was founded in 1989 by Senator Bob Kasten to train persons wishing to become professional staff for members of the US Congress.
organization.description: The Legislative Studies Institute was founded in 1989 by Senator Bob Kasten to train persons wishing to become professional staff for members of the US Congress.

organization.name: Edu-Tainment Live
organization.missionStatement:
EDU-TAINMENT LIVE! was created in response to a growing demand for high quality culturally diverse and affordable arts programming in an after school setting with strong community involvement that is accessible for all of the National Capital Area Youth.
EDU-TAINMENT LIVE! is a Washington DC based 501c3 nonprofit organization established to encourage the augmentation of music and performing arts programs in an after school setting with community at large. The goal is to use arts and entertainment as the tool to strengthen character and foster positive self-esteem in our diverse National Capital Area Youth (DC, MD & VA). EDU-TAINMENT LIVE! is committed to helping National Capital Area Youth by identifying and creating opportunities for them to learn grow respect one another have fun and discover their potential.
organization.description: Using common denominators creative, writing, music, dance and performance, EDU-TAINMENT LIVE will educate our youth on and involve them in the history of performing arts.

organization.name: NATIONAL COALITION AGAINST LEGALIZED GAMBLING
organization.missionStatement: The National Coalition AGAINST Legalized Gambling (NCALG) is a grassroots educational organization. We believe that given correct information, Americans will choose to eliminate legalized gambling from our communities and from the nation.
organization.description: NCALG, through its publications and web site provides information, research and technical support to state groups battling the expansion of gambling

organization.name: Psi Chi The National Honor Society in Psychology
organization.missionStatement: Psi Chi is the National Honor Society in Psychology, founded in 1929 for the purposes of encouraging, stimulating, and maintaining excellence in scholarship, and advancing the science of psychology. Membership is open to graduate and undergraduate men and women who are making the study of psychology one of their major interests, and who meet the minimum qualifications. Psi Chi is a member of the Association of College Honor Societies and is an affiliate of the American Psychological Association and the American Psychological Society.
organization.description: Psi Chi is the National Honor Society in Psychology, founded in 1929 for the purposes of encouraging, stimulating, and maintaining excellence in psychology.

organization.name: BRITISH AMERICAN SECURITY INFORMATION COUNCIL
organization.missionStatement: BASIC is a progressive and independent analysis and advocacy organization which researches and provides a critical examination of global security issues, including nuclear policies, military strategies, armaments and disarmament. BASIC assists in the development of global security policies, policy-making and the assessment of policy priorities, and promotes public awareness and understanding of these policies and of policy-making in Europe and the US.
organization.description: BASIC is an independent research organization that analyzes government policies and promotes public awareness of defense, disarmament, military strategy and nuclear policies in order to foster informed debate.

organization.name: NEIGHBORS OF SEATON PLACE
organization.missionStatement: Provide high quality, researched -based programs that meet the needs of children and their families. "Elevate,Educate and Inspire" Engage young people as Stakeholders
organization.description: "ELEVATE, EDUCATE AND INSPIRE" Engage all young people as stakeholders in crime prevention, life-skills and exposure to relevant and effective programs and practices.

organization.name: EARLY CHILDHOOD ACADEMY PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL
Asia Pacific Center for Justice and Peace
organization.missionStatement: The Asia Pacific Center for Justice and Peace promotes the realization of the full range of rights, including economic justice, political freedom and genuine security, for the peoples of Asia and the Pacific. We bring a progressive voice to US policies toward the region and provide channels of communication among grassroots organizations and religious bodies in Asia, the Pacific and the US.
organization.description: The Asia Pacific Center promotes the full range of human rights, including economic justice, political freedom and genuine security, bringing progressive voices to U.S. policies.

organization.name: LANGSTON JUNIOR BOYS & GIRLS GOLF CLUB
organization.missionStatement: LJRGC's currently enjoys a five-fold mission: (1) to inspire respect for self and others through the lessons learned from golf; (2) to cultivate principles of honesty and integrity; (3) to teach young people life lessons through the game of golf; (4) to foster an understanding of the inter-relationship between athletic and academic excellence through after-school and weekend academic programs; and, (5) to provide a safe, inclusive, and nurturing environment for all youth wishing to participate. LJRGC provides all programs at no cost to participate.
organization.description: Langston Junior Boys & Girls Golf Club (Langston Junior) is an all-volunteer organization that uses the game of golf to provide inner-city youth (ages 6-18) with the tools and skills needed to meet life's challenges.

organization.name: District of Columbia PTA
organization.missionStatement: To support and speak on behalf of children and youth in the schools, in the community, and before governmental bodies and other organizations that make decisions affecting children; To assist parents in developing the skills they need to raise and protect their children; To encourage parent and public involvement in the public schools of this nation.
organization.description: The mission of the National PTA is to support and speak on behalf of children and youth in the schools, to assist parents, and to encourage parent and public involvement in the public schools of this nation.

organization.name: Capital City Symphony
organization.missionStatement: The Capital City Symphony is the only orchestra-in-residence at the Atlas, a new performance space that serves as the anchor to the redevelopment of the H Street corridor. We bring high-quality classical music to residents who did not have access to such live performances, our concerts are free to children and we strive to bring together residents from Capitol Hill and H Street in performing and attending. We also provide a place for talented musicians to play together.
organization.description: The CCS makes great orchestral music approachable by presenting affordable and creative programs in a relaxed format and providing a musical outlet for talented players.

organization.name: Notre Dame Education Center, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1996 by the Sisters of Notre Dame de Namur, Notre Dame Education Center grew out of the need of residents of Northeast and Southeast D.C. for adult education. In a city where 50 percent of black males aged 18 to 35 have contact with the criminal justice system (either in jail, on parole or on probation) we recognize our clients personal dignity and help them take charge of their life circumstances.
organization.description: Notre Dame Education Center helps prepare our clients for success through innovative, technology-based programs that include preparation for General Education Development (GED), computer training classes and English Classes for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL).

organization.name: Sam-Kam Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to educate former child soldiers, refugees/displaced persons, women and youth, transforming the impoverished into economically sufficient, productive members of society. Sierra Leone has been entrenched in an infamously brutal civil war (primarily over control of the diamond mines) for over ten years. In this period, the formal education system has wholly deteriorated. In addition, thousands of innocents have been displaced from their homes. Farms and factories have been destroyed midst the conflict. Children have been forced into the bush to fight and many have grown up knowing of no life void of violence. We are intent on providing alternatives to bloodshed with concrete opportunities to build marketable skills. We want nothing short of leading the return to productive and civilized society in Sierra Leone, based upon the strong economic infrastructure of an educated and motivated workforce.
organization.description: Sam-Kam Foundation Incorporated is a nonprofit organization serving the war-ravaged country of Sierra Leone, West Africa and administratively headquartered in Washington, DC. SKFI is committed to providing computer skills through our informtation technology and vocational mechanics (carpentry, auto mechanics, plumbing, sewing welding) curriculums in effort to provide a means of economic independence.

organization.name: The Microelectronics Foundation
organization.missionStatement: Research and education needs completely supported and shared by companies who know they must go to the peripheries of today?s commercial and scientific endeavors, to participate in the innovative ?networks of creation.? Find solutions for the ?can that be done?? product innovations in microelectronics.
organization.description: We seek visionary leaders who see the connection between their passions and corporate mission and the vision and capabilities of the Foundation. We connect technology companies and customer communities seeking better ways of creating value with an open model of innovation.

organization.name: ULTRA URBAN LIFE TRAINING & REALITY ASSESSMENT TEEN CLUB
organization.missionStatement: The target area of Wards 6, 7, and 8 in the southeast quadrant of Washingoton, DC has an out-of-wedlock birthrate of 83.7 %. It is also estimated that one in twenty adults in Washington DC is infected with HIV, the virus that causes AIDS. Recognizing that a commitment to abstinence before marriage is the only sure method of preventing unwanted pregnancy, infection with sexually transmitted diseases and associated negative emotional outcomes, the objective of ULTRA Teen Choice is to help high-risk teens prepare for successful outcomes in their lives by adopting a sexually abstinent and drug-free lifestyle.
organization.description: To provide education, peer counseling and clubs for youth that will empower them to be successful in life by choosing abstinence from sex outside of marriage and abstinence from drugs and alcohol. We provide direct services to youth and youth serving organizations as well as training clients to implement the ULTRA Teen Choice program in their own setting.

organization.name: Dress for Success-Washington DC
organization.missionStatement: Dress for Success Washington DC provide women with the clothing, confidence, and career development to make a positive change in their lives.
organization.description: Dress for Success Washington DC provides free professional attire, mentoring programs, and career development tools to women in the DC Metropolitan community who are making the transition from welfare to work.

organization.name: Center for Environmental Citizenship, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Center for Environmental Citizenship was founded in 1992 by college students working to increase the citizen participation of their peers in behalf of environmental issues. We are a national, non-partisan, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to leadership capacity for the environmental movement and altering the relations of power between decision makers and emerging leaders. We work to ignite youth power, build leadership, and replenish the movement with a diverse base of new and innovative grassroots organizers.
organization.description: The Center for Environmental Citizenship is a nonprofit organization building leaders and igniting youth power to provide a steady stream of innovative young adult activists to the environmental movement.

organization.name: Energy Efficiency Export Council
organization.missionStatement: ECEE, a nonprofit consortium of five of the nation s leading advocates of energy efficiency, was formed in 1994 to promote the global use of energy efficiency products and services, in partnership with US companies and state officials, by increasing the awareness of their economic and environmental benefits. To support the global implementation of energy efficiency products and services, ECEE: conducts focused trade mission seminars; identifies financing options; conducts market assessments; and shares US experience regarding successful regulatory, voluntary, and demand side management programs through state- and federal-level peer exchanges.
organization.description: ECEE's mission is to promote the global use of energy efficiency products and services, in partnership with US companies and state officials, by increasing the awareness of their economic and environmental benefits.

organization.name: Sustainable Community Initiatives
organization.missionStatement:
SCI develops collaborative community projects and public education programs in the Mid-Atlantic region that enhance economic opportunities and connect businesses, institutions, and people more fully to their communities, the natural environment, and to each other. Toward this end, SCI undertakes the following in the Baltimore-Washington Metro Areas:
- Helps the business community, local government and the general public develop an awareness of the value of sustainable community development
- Endeavors to combine knowledge (through public education) and action (in the form of community programs) to promote prosperous and healthy communities
- Explores opportunities to develop educational, entrepreneurial and environmentally sound community-based projects
- Develops materials on the efficient use of urban environmental resources and sustainable activities for distribution to local businesses and to the general public
- Conducts sustainability seminars and workshops for a variety of audiences, e.g. financial institutions, housing development organizations, continuing education programs and community organizations
- Participates in efforts to promote more sustainable tax policies and land use codes
- Integrates into all of SCI's undertakings, the fundamental elements of Community Sustainability: community partnership, community enterprise, community conservation and community design
organization.description: SCI's mission is to develop collaborative community projects and public education programs that promote Community Sustainability in the Mid-Atlantic region.

organization.name: LA LECHE LEAGUE INTERNATIONAL INC
organization.missionStatement: To help mothers worldwide to breastfeed through mother-to-mother support, encouragement, information and education, and to promote a better understanding of breastfeeding as an important element in the healthy development of the baby and the mother. <p>Statistics<ul><li>LLLI provides over $33 million per year of in-kind services. LLLI reaches well over 300,000 people in 63 countries every month. Approximately 39,000 Leaders have been accredited in the past 44 years. Each LLL Group is attended by an average of 10 women per month, with many Groups attracting 20-30 mothers. LLLI's Center for Breastfeeding Information (CBI) contains more than 17,000 full-length research studies with more than 300 categories of breastfeeding data and adds over 125 new studies a month. The LLLI Board of Directors includes members from six countries.</li><li>7 LLLI maintains consultative status with the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), official working relations with the World Health Organization (WHO), acts as a registered Private Voluntary Organization (PVO) for the Agency of International Development (USAID), is an accredited member of the US Healthy Mothers/Healthy Babies Coalition, and is a founding member of the World Alliance for Breastfeeding Action (WABA)</li><li>LLLI is a member of the Child Survival Collaborations and Resources Group (CORE).</li></ul></p>
organization.description: Founded in 1956 by seven women who had learned about successful breastfeeding while nursing their own babies, La Leche League is the only organization with the sole purpose of helping breastfeeding mothers.

organization.name: Theater Alliance of Washington, DC
organization.missionStatement: Theater Alliance was founded in 1993 with the distinct goal of producing work that would illuminate the experiences, philosophies and interests of DC's diverse populations. That goal was furthered when Theater Alliance moved from its home at the Capitol Hill Arts Workshop to become the sole theater-in-residence at the H Street Playhouse. Season 2007-2008 (FY08) marks Theater Alliance's 6th Anniversary season in residence at the Playhouse. Under the leadership of Artistic Director Paul-Douglas Michnewicz, Theater Alliance's mission is to present new or rarely produced work geared towards attracting diverse and alternative audiences to our Northeast community.
organization.description: For the past five years, Theater Alliance has been at the forefront of a movement to initiate a new interest in the redevelopment of Washington's H Street, NE corridor. This area of the city suffered commercially and culturally during the civil rights riots in 1968 and has not fully recovered. At Theater Alliance, we believe that the arts are the engine for both economic and spiritual renewal for our community. By engaging our community, some of whom would not otherwise have the opportunity to participate in the theatrical experience, we can help its members to better understand historical and modern political and cultural dynamics, as well find a sense of their own potential for the future.

organization.name: World Children's Initiative Inc
organization.missionStatement:
World Children's Initiative, established in 2005, grew from the experience of three young professionals of South Asian descent during their visit to Sri Lanka in February 2005. For Dr. Kanishka Ratnayaka, who is an ethnic Sinhalese, and Mr. Pratheepan Gulasekaram, an ethnic Tamil, the service mission was a deeply personal matter undertaken to aid friends,and family. The two men reached across the frontlines of a bloody, decades-long civil war to collaborate in the relief effort. The group of friends visited relief camps and orphanages to provide medical assistance at makeshift treatment centers. In addition, they brought school supplies and clothes to orphanages on the hard-hit eastern shore of the island.
While providing immediate relief, the group also surveyed potential long-term projects for improvement of pediatric health care. Based on this assessment, the team decided to rehabilitate the pediatric ward at Matara General Hospital (MGH) in southern Sri Lanka.
Upon return to the U.S., Mr. Gulasekaram along with Drs. Daluvoy and Ratnayaka created a non-profit organization, World Children?s Initiative (WCI), for the purpose of rebuilding medical and educational infrastructure for children in developing areas across the globe.
organization.description: World Children's Initiative is an international nongovernmental organization that works with local entities to improve the existing quality and availability of health care and education for children.

organization.name: Common Sense About Kids and Guns
organization.missionStatement:
Common Sense and the unprecedented, diverse coalition of organizations endorsing our message of safety and responsibility have joined together because of one overarching principle: the safety and protection of our children is paramount. Although we may differ on some areas of public policy, we are united in our belief that we can best protect our children by addressing the issue of children and guns in a responsible and inclusive way.
Our message is common sense. To ensure the safety of children, all gun owners should: 1) unload and lock up their guns; 2) lock up bullets separately; and 3) hide keys where kids are unable to find them. All parents MUST: 1) ask if guns are safely stored where their kids visit and play; 2) talk to their kids about guns; and 3) teach young kids not to touch guns, and to tell an adult if they find one.
organization.description: Common Sense is a non-profit group of gun owners and non-owners committed to reducing gun deaths and injuries to children and teens by promoting common sense safety measures and personal and community responsibility for preventing unsupervised access to guns.

organization.name: Children's Environmental Health Network
organization.missionStatement: CEHN works with diverse organizations and individuals to promote child-protective policies, train professionals, educate the general public, and promote key research efforts, within the field of children's environmental health.
organization.description: CEHN works to protect the fetus and child from environmental health hazards and to promote a healthy and safe environment.

organization.name: Machik Corp
organization.missionStatement: Machik is a nonprofit organization working to develop new opportunities for education, capacity-building and social innovation on the Tibetan plateau. Guided by a commitment to human potential, Machik builds local and global partnerships in creating new pathways and solutions for realizing a healthier and more sustainable future for Tibetan communities.
organization.description: Creating new pathways for communities on the Tibetan plateau.

organization.name: JUST ENOUGH SO U STOP INC
organization.missionStatement: Just Enough So U Stop, founded in 2000, came about out of a need for substance abuse treatment for former and current individuals involved in criminal activity due to substance use in the metropolitan Washington DC area. We also found that the adolescent population was becoming heavily addicted and there were no slots available to treat these adolescents affected by substance abuse. Throughout our experiences working for secular organizations that provided treatment for adults, we found that the counselors providing services were not adequately trained, and relied heavily on their personal experience which did not bode well for everyone's treatment. We felt that if the counselors are properly trained in the functions of counseling, the relapse rate of clients would be reduced. Just Enough's goal is to assist the individual seeking treatment using a balance of spiritual and clinical methodologies to produce a well balanced human. We provide the training to those seeking certification to ensure that the proper methods are executed to provide the highest level of care to those who receive assistance.
organization.description: Just Enough So U Stop is a faith based, Washington, DC Metro area human development,adolescent & adult outpatient substance abuse treatment and consulting organization.

organization.name: Capitol Hill Crisis Pregnancy Center
organization.missionStatement: Capitol Hill Pregnancy Center opened its doors in 1985 and is located strategically on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC. In 15 years of existence Capitol Hill Pregnancy Center has been able to minister to over 15,000 women in a variety of ways. Over 1200 babies have been born as a result of this ministry. Washington, DC has proportionately the highest number of pregnancies, the highest number of teen births and the highest number of abortions in the nation. Abortions outnumber live births in Washington, DC. Our mission is to serve Christ by providing intervention and abortion alternatives for women facing crisis pregnancies; to prepare and train parents through education for pregnancy, birth and beyond; express the love of Christ through emotional support and friendship; and encourage a lifestyle that reflects godly values, especially with regard to sexual behavior.
organization.description: Capitol Hill Pregnancy Center provides free pregnancy tests, Maternity and baby clothes and supplies, parenting classes, abstinence programs in the schools, and post-abortion Bible studies. All services are free.

organization.name: CENTER FOR MINORITY STUDIES INC
organization.missionStatement: The Center for Minority Studies provide quality health-related support services to underprivileged, disadvantaged, low socioeconomic status clients in Washington, DC and its surrounding metropolitan area.
organization.description: The Center for Minority Studies has been dedicated to decreasing health disparities by utilizing clinical pharmacist to provide medication therapy management and health topic presentations.

organization.name: Women's Aglow Fellowship
organization.missionStatement: Aglow International is an intercultural transdenominational organization of Christian women with more than 3,500 fellowships in more than 151 nations. Our mission is to lead women to Jesus Christ and provide opportunity for Christian women to grow in their faith and minister to others. Aglow's vision to impact the lives of women worldwide is expressed in the strategic focuses of: Prayer, Evangelism, Relationship, and Reconciliation.<p>Aglow International was founded in 1967 by four American women who prayed for a way to reach out to other Christian women in simple fellowship, free from denominational constraints. The first meeting drew more than 100 women to a local hotel. Today Aglow touches the lives of an estimated 1,000,000 women on six continents through local group meetings, Bible studies, seminars, retreats, conferences, and various outreaches.
organization.description: Aglow International is a worldwide, transdenominational organization of Christian women with vision to lead women to Jesus Christ and provide opportunity for Christian women to grow in their faith and minister to others.

organization.name: Washington Savoyards, Ltd.
organization.missionStatement: As the light opera company of Washington, the Washington Savoyards seeks to make opera theatre accessible and enjoyable to all in the Washington metropolitan area. Focusing on opera and theatre professionals resident in the metropolitan area, the Company provides employment, performance experience, training, and artistic support to its performers and crew members. In addition to drawing on professional singers, it also attracts music, theatre, and opera students from Washington area colleges and universities.
organization.description: The Washington Savoyards is the opera theatre company of Washington. It performs comic and light opera, operetta, and musical theatre.
