CORPORATION FOR PUBLIC BROADCASTING
organization.missionStatement: The mission of CPB is to facilitate the development of, and ensure universal access to, non-commercial high-quality programming and telecommunications services. It does this in conjunction with non-commercial educational telecommunications licensees across America.
organization.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting is a private, nonprofit corporation created by Congress in 1967 to support public broadcasting.

organization.name: Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars
organization.missionStatement: The Woodrow Wilson Center was established by legislation in 1968 to symbolize and strengthen the "fruitful relation between the world of learning and the world of public affairs." Created within the Smithsonian Institution, the Center has an independent Board of Trustees and administration. By bringing Fellows from around the world to Washington, encouraging discourse among disciplines and professions, and publishing the results of these activities, the Center enriches the quality of knowledge and debate in the nation's capital and throughout the world. We sponsor hundreds of conferences and lectures which are open to the public, and publish books and working papers; our journal is "The Wilson Quarterly." "Dialogue" a weekly radio interview show, is nationally syndicated.
organization.description: The Woodrow Wilson Center was established by legislation in 1968 to symbolize and strengthen the "fruitful relation between the world of learning and the world of public affairs."

organization.name: PHARMACEUTICAL RESEARCH AND MANUFACTURERS OF AMERICA
INTERNATIONAL UNION OF BRICKLAYERS AND ALLIED CRAFTWORKERS
DATA FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: To alleviate poverty in Sub-Saharan Africa through raising awareness, primarily in the USA, of the crises in Africa of Debt, AIDS, and Trade and thereby ensure that Africa receives or is able to earn the resources necessary to overcome the AIDS emergency. And achieve rapid progress towards shared property in Africa.
organization.description: DATA is a new non-profit organization which aims to fight poverty in Africa by raising awareness about the crisis of unpayable DEBTS, the urgent need for more and better foreign development assistance, especially to fight AIDS, and the unfair TRADE rules which keep AFRICA poor and marginalized.

organization.name: Safe Kids Worldwide
organization.missionStatement: Safe Kids Worldwide has worked steadily to decrease death and injury in the areas of traffic safety (passenger, pedestrian and bicyclist), drowning, fire and burns, falls, poisoning and unintentional firearm injury. Unintentional injury kills one million children per year worldwide. In the United States and most other industrialized nations, unintentional injury is the number one casuse of death in children ages 1 to 14, comprising 36.4 percent of child mortality in the United States. Safe Kids Worldwide and its coalitions around the country made up of firefighters, nurses, law enforcement officials and others carry out the mission "to save a child s life every day." Safe Kids Worldwide has provided life-saving assistance and more than 2 million bicycle helmets, 250,000 smoke alarms to families in need and inspected more than 800,000 car seats.
organization.description: Safe Kids Worldwide and its 600 coalitions and chapters in all 50 states, the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico lead the fight against the number one killer of children ages 14 and under unintentional childhood injury through education and safety device distribution to families in need.

organization.name: First Book
organization.missionStatement: Studies show that the single strongest indicator of a child?s future reading success is simple: the number of books in the home. Yet access to books is virtually nonexistent for children in need. In low-income neighborhoods, there is access to, on average, just one age-appropriate book for every 300 children, compared with 13 books for every child in middle-income families. More than 80% of preschool and after-school programs serving children from low-income families have no books at all for the children they serve.
organization.description: First Book provides children from low-income families the opportunity to read and own their first new books. Since 1992 we have distributed over 50 million new books.

organization.name: Ford's Theatre Society
organization.missionStatement:
Ford's Theatre is dedicated to developing and producing innovative and distinctive new American plays and musicals that celebrate cultural diversity and the American spirit. Since re-opening, Ford's has launched a series of landmark original productions including: Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope; Will Rogers' U.S.A.; Give 'em Hell, Harry!; Your Arms Too Short to Box With God; Hot Mikado, Elmer Gantry; Kudzu, A Southern Musical, and Eleanor: An American Love Story. In addition, Ford's has given Washington audiences their first glimpse of such Pulitzer Prize winners as A Soldier's Play and The Shadow Box.
Operation Discovery, Ford's subsidized ticket program, has been a vital part of community outreach since 1977. The program has introduced more than 100,000 economically disadvantaged young people and adults to what is for many, their first theatrical performance. Ford's also conducts Opening Act workshops for student groups in tandem with performances and provides student and teacher guides to our productions.
organization.description: Ford's Theatre, which re-opened its doors in 1968, is dedicated to developing and producing innovative and distinctive new American plays and musicals as a tribute to President Lincoln's love for the performing arts.

organization.name: National Association of Child Care Resource & Referral Agencies
organization.missionStatement: NACCRRA is a non-profit organization with the mission to provide vision, leadership, and support to community child care resource and referral and to promote national policies and partnerships committed to the development and learning of all children.
organization.description: NACCRRA is a national network of resource and referral organizations committed to the development and learning of all children.

organization.name: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF NEGRO WOMEN INC
AIR TRANSPORT ASSOCIATION OF AMERICA INC
DALLAS MORSE COORS FOUNDATION FOR THE PERFORMING ARTS TR
NATIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS MEMORIAL FUND INC
RECORD INDUSTRY ASSOCIATION OF AMERICA INC
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MANUFACTURERS OF THE USA
COMMUNICATIONS CONSORTIUM MEDIA CENTER
organization.missionStatement: CCMC's mission is to use communications strategies for policy change.
organization.description:
CCMC seeks to influence public policy in ways that respect and support individual rights, healthy families, cultural diversity and a sustainable environment. The foundation of our initiatives is collaboration among organizations sharing policy goals.
CCMC was founded in 1988 by a team of communications strategists committed to helping nonprofit organizations communicate more effectively with the media, policymakers and other key audiences.

organization.name: American Fund for Charities
organization.missionStatement: The American Fund for Charities is supported by numbers of donors who help The American Fund support charitable activities and charities in the USA and throughout the world.
organization.description: The American Fund supports charities and charitable activities throughout the world.

organization.name: MAG AMERICA INC
organization.missionStatement: To save lives and build futures by enabling communities to escape the suffering and poverty caused by conflict. MAG America supports programs that promote human security, advance post-conflict economic development, improve global health, and reduce poverty by clearing landmines, unexploded ordnance, and explosive remnants of war. We provide a secure environment that allows people to return to their homes, grow food, raise cattle, collect water, walk to school, and simply live in safety.
organization.description: MAG America saves lives and builds futures by enabling post-conflict communities to escape the suffering and poverty caused by war.

organization.name: BRICKLAYERS AND ALLIED CRAFTSMEN INTERNATIONAL HEALTH FUND
National Right to Life Committee Educational Trust Fund
organization.missionStatement: The principal goal of the National Right to Life Educational Trust Fund is to educate the public on the sanctity of human life through educational programs specifically related to abortion, euthanasia, and infanticide, and to improve social awareness and responsibility for human life, particularly for such vulnerable and disadvantaged individuals and classes as the mentally and physically disabled, aged, and children--both before and after their birth. To achieve these goals, the Trust Fund publishes and distributes books and brochures, films and displays of audio or visual materials, holds seminars and conferences, and advirtises on right to life issues through television, radio and newspaper venues. The board of directors meets quarterly, approves the annual Trust Fund budget, and monitors the programs. The Trust Fund is a separately segregated fund from the NRL Committee and has received 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status from the Internal Revenue Service. Contributions are tax-deductible. The Trust Fund is audited by a certified public accountant annually.
organization.description: The National Right to Life Educational Trust Fund promotes respect for human life through educational programs opposing abortion, infanticide and euthanasia, and supports referral and adoption services for women with crisis pregnancies.

organization.name: Woolly Mammoth Theatre Co.
organization.missionStatement: Under the leadership of founding Artistic Director Howard Shalwitz and Managing Director Jeffrey Herrmann, Woolly Mammoth has come to be acknowledged as Washington's most daring theatre company, as a regional and national leader in the development of new plays, and as one of the best known and most influential small theatres in America. The Company has garnered such a reputation by holding fast to its unique mission: "to ignite an explosive engagement between theatre artists and the community by developing, producing and promoting new plays that explore the edges of theatrical style and human experience, and by implementing new ways to use the artistry of theatre to serve the citizens of Washington, DC."
organization.description: Founded in 1980 by forward-thinking theatre artists, Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company offers citizens and visitors of the Washington metropolitan area a unique and modern theatre experience. A theatre with scope, Woolly Mammoth pushes the envelope of artistic excellence by choosing plays from a variety of genres with thought-provoking content; hiring designers and artists who thrive on and expect to be challenged; and continuing to strengthen its relationship with its own community by providing some of the most impressive theatre education programming in the country.

organization.name: Sister Cities International
organization.missionStatement: Sister Cities International is a non-profit citizen diplomacy network creating and strengthening partnerships between U.S. and international communities in an effort to increase global cooperation at the municipal level, to promote cultural understanding, and to stimulate economic development. SCI leads the U.S. movement for local communities to partner with counterparts abroad and develop volunteer action by motivating and empowering private citizens, municipal officials, and business leaders to conduct long-term programs of mutual benefit.
organization.description: Sister Cities International is a membership association for sister city, county, and state programs around the world. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., it is the official organization which links jurisdictions from the U.S. with communities worldwide. Currently SCI represents over 2,500 communities in 134 countries around the world.

organization.name: PHARMACEUTICAL RESEARCH AND MANUFACTURERS OF AMERICA FND INC
GREATER WASHINGTON SOCIETY OF ASSOCIATION EXECUTIVES INC
NATIONAL CENTER ON EDUCATION & THE ECONOMY
AMERICAN CANCER SOCIETY CANCER ACTION NETWORK INC
American Immigration Law Foundation
organization.missionStatement: AILF was established in 1987 as a tax-exempt, not-for-profit educational and service organization. Working closely with leading immigration experts throughout the country, AILF has established three core program areas: the Legal Action Center, the Public Education Program, and an Exchange Visitor Program. Through these programs, the Foundation sponsors numerous awards programs, publishes policy reports, engages in impact litigation, and provides policymakers and the public with complete and accurate information about the benefits of immigration.
organization.description: AILF promotes public understanding of immigration law and policy through education, policy analysis, and support to litigators. We seek to counter anti-immigrant groups that would close America's doors to future newcomers, making the case that America is a Nation of Immigrants.

organization.name: THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS
organization.missionStatement: To engage leaders of the national nonprofit health & human service sector in collective efforts to advance the effectiveness of health and human services in the United States
organization.description: Provides professional development and networking and facilitates collaboration among leaders of national nonprofit health and human service, human development and community development organizations.

organization.name: World Environment Center Inc
organization.missionStatement: WEC's mission is to: Promote business and societal value by advancing solutions to sustainable development-related problems; Foster leading edge ideas about economic development, environmental protection and social responsibility through roundtables and other forums that engage the leadership of a diverse number of organizations; and Recognize performance excellence by companies that advance sustainable development.
organization.description: Founded in 1974, the World Environment Center is an independent, global non-profit, non-advocacy organization that advances sustainable development through the business practices of member companies and in partnership with governments, multi-lateral organizations, non-governmental organizations, universities and other stakeholders.

organization.name: Theodore Roosevelt Conservation Partnership, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 2002, the TRCP unites the voices of more than 100,000 individual grassroots partners and more than 1,500 state and local organizations, as well as members of 23 unions of the AFL-CIO that represent millions of hunters, anglers and conservationists. As a result of its coalition and union relationships, TRCP has created an extensive sportsmen's network which is the basis of regional and state public education campaigns and national media publicity campaigns working to ensure that America's natural resources are not taken for granted by federal decision-makers and the public.
organization.description: TRCP represents a coalition of the nation's leading hunting, fishing, and conservation groups working together to guarantee all Americans quality places to hunt and fish.

organization.name: Justice at Stake Campaign Inc
organization.missionStatement: The Justice at Stake Campaign is a nonpartisan national partnership working to keep our courts fair and impartial. Across America, Campaign partners help protect our courts through public education, grass-roots organizing, coalition-building and reform. The Campaign provides strategic coordination and brings unique organizational, communications and research resources to the work of its partners and allies at the national, state and local levels.
organization.description: Justice at Stake Campaign and its partners have come together to help Americans keep special interests and political pressure out of the courtroom.

organization.name: Zurich International School Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Zurich International School Foundation provides a U.S. administrative and fundraising arm for ZIS.
organization.description: Supports the activities of the Zurich International School (ZIS), an international day school for students ages 3-18 in the Zurich area.

organization.name: Capital Athletic Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Capital Athletic Foundation is to foster character development by promoting the American ideals of sportsmanship in all endeavors. These ideals include integrity, honor, brotherhood, morality, leadership and good citizenship. Sportsmanship is ethical behavior both on and off the playing field; both in athletics and in business; both as a youth and as an adult.
organization.description: CAF recognize individuals and organizations that exemplify the ideals of sportsmanship and awards grants to support programs and activities that develop sportsmanship, particularly for disadvantaged populations.

organization.name: Council for Basic Education
organization.missionStatement: CBE believes in the principle of universal education and in the tax-supported public school system. Only by the maintenance of high academic standards can the ideal of democratic education be realized. CBE believes that there is a direct relationship between a healthy democracy, a viable economy, and excellence in education. Clear standards, aligned to appropriate curriculum, must be used as a measure of student progress.
organization.description: The Council for Basic Education (CBE), an independent voice of educational excellence for all students, advocates high academic standards and exemplary teaching.

organization.name: ARNOLD & PORTER MEDICAL BENEFITS PLAN TRUST
AMERICAN SMALL MANUFACTURERS COALITION
organization.missionStatement: The ASMC helps American small manufacturers succeed.
organization.description: ASMC is a trade association of MEP Centers nationwide which advocates for continued federal funding for the MEP program.

organization.name: ALLIANCE FOR QUALITY NURSING HOME CARE INC
COUNCIL FOR AFFORDABLE QUALITY HEALTHCARE INC
National Women's Health Network Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The National Women's Health Network improves the health of all women by developing and promoting a critical analysis of health issues to influence public policy and support consumer decision-making. The Network aspires to a health care system that is guided by social justice and reflects the needs of diverse women.
organization.description: To improve women's health through access to excellent, thorough information, research, services, and technologies that are free from profit, prejudice, and sexism.

organization.name: CHOICE USA
organization.missionStatement: Choice USA mobilizes and provides ongoing support to the diverse, upcoming generation of leaders who promote and protect reproductive choice both now and in the future.
organization.description: As a national pro-choice organization, Choice USA gives emerging leaders the tools they need to organize, network, and exchange ideas to build a youth-centered pro-choice agenda and mobilize communities for reproductive freedom.

organization.name: THE LEONSIS FOUNDATION INC
organization.missionStatement:
The Leonsis Foundation creates opportunities for children that enable them to reach their highest potential. The foundation partners with and supports organizations with the creativity, skill, and dedication to help children overcome obstacles and achieve their goals.
Believing that education is the key to self-empowerment, the foundation provides funding for scholarships, tutoring, and career mentoring that will expand students' horizons beyond their local neighborhood. The foundation also supports programs which develop technical proficiency with computers and the internet, since online communication provides individuals with new ways to break down barriers and gain knowledge.
Health-related issues create additional challenges and roadblocks for some children, whether the child lacks access to adequate medical treatment or develops an incurable disease. Consequently, the foundation allocates resources to programs which focus on improving the odds that all children can lead healthy, active lives.
Certain other social and extracurricular activities are of interest to the foundation provided they empower children and foster creative self-expression. These programs are evaluated on an individual basis to see how they may complement or enhance the education and health related projects already being funded.
Unfortunately, many children face challenges and circumstances that create additional obstacles in their quest to succeed. The Leonsis Foundation firmly believes these children deserve the same opportunities and experiences that others take for granted. Together with the organizations it supports, the foundation is dedicated to improving the lives of children, educating their minds, and instilling in them the confidence to pursue their dreams.
organization.description: The Leonsis Foundation makes grants to organizations in the Washington, D.C. area focused on education, technology and health services for the the children of D.C.

organization.name: National Network of Runaway and Youth Services, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The mission of National Network is to connect and champion the needs of runaway, homeless, and other disconnected youth through our "TOOLBOX", which includes advocacy, innovation, community building and services.
organization.description:
The National Network for Youth has been serving the youth of America for more than 30 years by championing the needs of runaway, homeless and other disconnected youth. We do this through advocacy, innovation and services. Our reach is extended through our member organizations, allowing us to be in numerous communities throughout the country as we create a neighborhood of support for the next generation.
Our members are community-based organizations along with their neighborhood youth, adults, associations, and regional and state networks of youth workers. These builders of the future provide street-based services, emergency shelter, transitional living programs, counseling, and social, health, educational and job-related services to over 2.5 million youth each year.
The National Network is committed to ensuring that opportunities for growth and development be available to our neighbors everywhere. The youth we work with face greater odds due to abuse and neglect, homelessness, lack of resources, community prejudice, differing abilities and other life challenges.

organization.name: Securities And Exchange Commission Historical Society
organization.missionStatement: The purpose of the SEC Historical Society is to contribute to investor understanding of how the SEC has shaped and continues to shape U.S. and international capital markets.
organization.description: The SEC Historical Society preserves and shares the history of the SEC and the securities industry through its virtual museum and archive at www.sechistorical.org, free and available worldwide at all times.

organization.name: NATIONAL RIGHT TO LIFE COMMITTEE INC
UNITED STATES-ISRAEL SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY FOUNDATION INCORPORATED
COUNCIL OF THE GREAT CITY SCHOOLS
CIA Officers Memorial Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The Foundation was created by a group of concerned Americans who wish to assist the survivors and dependents of CIA officers who died in the line of duty as the result of hostile action. These survivors and dependents deserve the support of their fellow Americans because of the supreme sacrifice made by their loved ones in defending the freedoms that all Americans enjoy.
organization.description: The CIA Officers Memorial Foundation was established to provide financial and other assistance to the families of CIA officers killed as a result of hostile action in the line of duty in the current war on terrorism and future conflicts. The first fund established by the Foundation will provided assistance to the family of Mike Spann, a CIA employee killed in Afghanistan.

organization.name: GIFTS FOR THE HOMELESS
organization.missionStatement:
Gifts for the Homeless, Inc. ("GFTH") is a nonprofit organization founded and staffed by volunteers from the Washington, D.C. area legal community.
The principal objective of GFTH is to raise money for the purchase of new clothing and collect donations of certain types of used clothing and other needed items from attorneys and staff of Washington, D.C. area law firms, government agencies, in-house corporate legal departments and other legal organizations. In pursuing this objective, the GFTH Board of Directors has established the following priorities:
to reach the homeless who live on the street in all four quadrants of the District of Columbia;
to reach the homeless who live in shelters and in transitional housing;
to reach the homeless in neighboring communities outside the District of Columbia when, and if, GFTH believes it has fully served the needs of the District; and
to build a reputation for reliability by working with a core group of homeless service providers.
GFTH does not typically distribute clothing directly to individuals living on the street, but works through a network of over 40 homeless service providers that include shelters, temporary residences and soup kitchens and wagons.
GFTH pursues its objectives through a two-track approach. GFTH solicits direct monetary donations from the Washington, D.C. area legal community to purchase new clothes. Typically, items purchased include: (1) warm winter accessories, such as hats and gloves; (2) undergarments, such as thermals, socks and underwear; and (3) heavy bedding items, such as polar fleeces. GFTH also accepts donations of certain types of used clothing and other needed items. The used clothing effort seeks to obtain those items most frequently requested by homeless service providers: (1) warm winter clothing, such as winter coats, sweaters and turtlenecks; (2) business attire, such as suits, shirts, blouses, ties and shoes; and (3) household linens, such as sheets, pillowcases and towels.
organization.description: GFTH raises money for the purchase of new clothing and collects used clothing and other needed items for the DC area homeless.

organization.name: LINDA AND KENNETH POLLIN FOUNDATION INC
NATIONAL LEAGUE OF CITIES INSTITUTE INC
Toastmasters International
organization.missionStatement: The mission of a Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive and positive learning environment in which every member has the opportunity to develop communication and leadership skills, which in turn foster self-confidence and personal growth.
organization.description: Toastmasters International empowers people to achieve their full potential and realize their dreams.

organization.name: THE BEAD SOCIETY OF GREATER WASHINGTON INC
organization.missionStatement: The Bead Society of Greater Washington is dedicated to furthering the understanding of people through their beads and ornaments. Our mission is twofold: -- to encourage the scholarly study of beads, which are among the oldest, most universal, and most enduring artifacts of mankind, and -- to foster public appreciation of beads as objects of beauty that have been used not only for adornment but as status symbols and protective amulets in ancient, ethnic, and contemporary cultures.
organization.description: Together the Bead Society of Greater Washington and The Bead Museum are dedicated to furthering the understanding and appreciation of beads.

organization.name: THE SERPENTINE SOCIETY INC
organization.missionStatement: To provide educational, charitable and social welfare services for, on behalf of and in furtherance of the interests of the University of Virginia and its gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender alumni, students, faculty and staff.
organization.description: Our vision is to be an inclusive alumni/ae organization dedicated to reaching out to and advocating for all gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgendered UVa alumni/ae, faculty, and students by connecting to each other and to the University.

organization.name: FRIENDS OF CITY UNIVERSITY INC
organization.missionStatement: We will provide rigorous research and education for the world of work.
organization.description: To solicit contributions in the United States and elsewhere for the benefit of City University in London.

organization.name: AMERICAN FRIENDS OF CECILYS FUND INC
organization.missionStatement:
We support the education of Zambian children who have been orphaned, or made vulnerable, by AIDS, and help them to play their own part in building a healthier Zambia.
Through Cecily's Fund, many children receive an education that would otherwise be denied them, because of their inability to afford the fees, uniforms, shoes, books and other materials.
Cecily's Fund was established in 1998, in memory of Cecily Eastwood, an English girl who was sadly killed in a traffic accident while working as a volunteer with orphaned children in Zambia.
organization.description: Ensuring that orphaned and vulnerable children in Zambia are able to access their right to a school education, and promoting post-school opportunities for them.

organization.name: African American Heritage Preservation Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The <b>African American Heritage Preservation Foundation, Inc. (AAHPF),</b> a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization, which is dedicated to the preservation of African American history and historical sites, was established in June 1994 by E. Renee Ingram. <br><br>The Foundation was created as the result of Ms. Ingram's efforts to preserve her family's cemetery, an endangered rural cemetery, which ultimately was placed on the <b>Commonwealth of Virginia Landmarks Register</b> and the <b>National Register of Historic Places</b> in 1993. The Stanton Family Cemetery was the first free African American privately held cemetery to be placed on these Registers in the country. <br><br>AAHPF has been primarily engaged in activities that include the preservation, maintenance, and awareness of endangered or little-known African American historical sites in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeast Regions. <br><br>In addition, AAHPF acts as a resource center for community groups, preservationists, genealogical and historical societies, not-for-profit organizations and government entities, nation-wide, needing assistance in the preservation of African American historical sites and history. The Foundation has its own web site that provides information on its activities and serves as a research tool that is used by teachers and students ranging from middle school through postgraduate studies.<br><br>
organization.description: The African American Heritage Preservation Foundation, Inc. fosters awareness of endangered or little known African American historical sites and its history.

organization.name: THE INSTITUTE FOR HEALTH TECHNOLOGY STUDIES
Friends of the Alnwick Garden
organization.missionStatement:
The mission of the Friends of the Alnwick Garden is so support the work of the Alnwick Garden in becoming the most magnificent garden created in Europe in the last hundred years. The objectives of the Alnwick Garden are as follows:
* to enable visitors to enjoy a unique combination of technology, horticulture, art and architecture of the highest standard
* to be a catalyst for the regeneration and diversification of the local and regional economies
* to be a world-class attraction
* to welcome visitors of all ages and abilities,364 days of the year
* to stimulate the imagination and foster aesthetic,scientific, recreational, naturalistic and humanistic values
* to offer an excellent resource for study,learning and exploration
* to operate in an environmentally responsible manner
organization.description: The Friends of the Alnwick Garden (US) was founded to assist with the development and on-going operations of one of the largest garden projects in the last century - the already award winning Alnwick Gardens in Northumberland, England. Further, the organization is committed to the development of educational programs, exhibits and research on topics relating to Alnwick Gardens and horticulture, botany, landscape design and the environment in general.

organization.name: D C CHILDCARE CORPORATION
organization.missionStatement:
Access to affordable, quality early care and education is critical for children to develop well and be ready for school. However, there is not enough high quality early care and education for children of the ?working poor? in the District of Columbia. 20% of young children in the city live in poverty. 62% of children have working parents. Currently, the city has about 1,500 children on the waiting list for child care subsidies. This number only accounts for families up to about 220% of the poverty level. Above that level are many hard working families that cannot afford to pay the high costs of quality child care. It is this segment of the population ? above the city subsidy level but far from able to afford market rates ? that DC Childcare is particularly interested in serving.
In addition to affordability problems, families face problems finding quality child care. There are 360 licensed child care centers in DC. Only 87 of them are accredited by the National Association for the Education of Young Children. Most of the downtown accredited centers are sponsored by the federal government primarily for federal employees; there are few spaces for the general working population and they are expensive.
organization.description: Public/private partnership provides quality, affordable early care/education in downtown DC.

organization.name: SAVE THE RHINO INTERNATIONAL INC
organization.missionStatement: Save the Rhino International Inc works in close consultation with managers and communities in wildlife areas and provides direct support for rhino- and community-based conservation projects in Africa and Asia. By providing a secure environment for rhinos, we also ensure the survival of numerous other species that share their habitat.
organization.description: Save the Rhino International Inc fundraises to ensure the survival of the rhinoceros species in the wild.

organization.name: Understanding Government
organization.missionStatement: Understanding Government fulfills an essential but often unseen need by focusing greater attention on the executive branch of government, where policies are implemented and where the rubber meets the road in our system of government. By stimulating more informed reporting and analysis of the activities of government agencies, Understanding Government helps the public become more informed about the executive branch of government, where policy is supposed to be turned into action. The public knows little about what happens there -- about which agencies are doing useful work and which are wasting money. Unfortunately, few journalists or political scientists are aware of what they don't know about the executive branch, so the first step toward achieving the purpose of Understanding Government is to create that awareness among journalists and political scientists and to help them understand the culture of bureaucracy -- through articles and seminars written or conducted by Understanding Government and others who are aware of the widespread ignorance of the executive branch. The effectiveness of agencies like the FAA, the FDA, and the CDC can literally be a matter of life and death. The ultimate goal of Understanding Government is better government -- government that is better because it receives more informed criticism. In addition our work will, by explaining what actually happens in government agencies, attract to government service talented people who are not now aware of the potential for an important, challenging and satisfying career in government.
organization.description: The purpose of Understanding Government is to increase government accountability and effectiveness by improving journalism about the executive branch and the realities of policy implementation in government.

organization.name: United Macedonian Diaspora
organization.missionStatement:
Founded in 2004, United Macedonian Diaspora (UMD) is an international non-governmental organization addressing the interests and needs of Macedonians and Macedonian communities throughout the world.
UMD's main goals are to foster unity among Macedonian people, and advance their cause. We work to promote our historical, spiritual and cultural heritage while advancing the Macedonian tradition within the framework of various advocacy, educational, and charitable programs.
organization.description: Founded in 2004, United Macedonian Diaspora (UMD) is an international non-governmental organization addressing the interests and needs of Macedonians and Macedonian communities throughout the world.

Carnegie Institution of Washington
organization.missionStatement: The Institution's purpose, as conceived by Andrew Carnegie, is to "encourage, in the broadest and most liberal manner, investigation, research, and discovery, and the application of knowledge to the improvement of mankind." The Carnegie Institution is devoted to addressing fundamental questions on the frontiers of biology, earth sciences, and astronomy that its trustees and staff consider to be among the most significant in science. Its funds are used to support projects at its own research departments and to conduct a program of advanced education at the predoctoral and postdoctoral levels. It also offers programs for elementary school teachers and children in Washington, DC.
organization.description: The Carnegie Institution of Washington, a private, nonprofit organization engaged in basic research and advanced education in biology, astronomy, and the earth sciences, was founded by Andrew Carnegie in 1902.

organization.name: FINCA International, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: FINCA provides financial services to the world's poorest families so they can create their own jobs, raise household incomes and improve their standard of living. We deliver these services through a global network of locally managed, self-supporting institutions. Our goal is to become the leading global microfinance institution by providing financial services to more than one million clients annually by 2010, while operating with the highest commercial principles of performance, transparency and sustainability.
organization.description: FINCA provides financial services to the world's poorest families so they can create their own jobs, raise household incomes and improve their standard of living.

organization.name: Society for Neuroscience
organization.missionStatement:
SfN's mission is to:
1. Advance the understanding of the brain and the nervous system by bringing together scientists of diverse backgrounds, by facilitating the integration of research directed at all levels of biological organization, and by encouraging translational research and the application of new scientific knowledge to develop improved disease treatments and cures.
2. Provide professional development activities, information, and educational resources for neuroscientists at all stages of their careers, including undergraduates, graduates, and postdoctoral fellows, and increase participation of scientists from a diversity of cultural and ethnic backgrounds.
3. Promote public information and general education about the nature of scientific discovery and the results and implications of the latest neuroscience research. Support active and continuing discussions on ethical issues relating to the conduct and outcomes of neuroscience research.
4. Inform legislators and other policymakers about new scientific knowledge and recent developments in neuroscience research and their implications for public policy, societal benefit, and continued scientific progress.
organization.description: The Society for Neuroscience is a nonprofit membership organization of basic scientists and physicians who study the brain and nervous system.

organization.name: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF SCIENCE
organization.missionStatement: To advance science and innovation throughout the world for the benefit of all people.
organization.description: AAAS, an international organization that advances science around the world, publishes the journal Science and spearheads programs that increase the understanding of science worldwide.

organization.name: International Republican Institute
organization.description: A nonprofit, nonpartisan organization, the International Republican Institute (IRI) advances freedom and democracy worldwide by developing political parties, civic institutions, open elections, good governance and the rule of law.

organization.name: AMERICANS FOR THE ARTS INC
organization.missionStatement: Americans for the Arts' mission is to increase private and public resources and advance public policies that create a climate in which the arts can thrive and promote participation in the arts by all Americans.
organization.description: Americans for the Arts is the leading national organization working to ensure that every American has the opportunity to appreciate, value and participate in all forms of the arts.

organization.name: National Park Foundation
organization.missionStatement:
The National Park Foundation, chartered by Congress, strengthens the enduring connection between the American people and their National Parks by raising private funds, making strategic grants, creating innovative partnerships and increasing public awareness.
Recognizing that private funding is essential to help preserve and enhance the legacy of our National Parks, Congress in 1967 chartered the National Park Foundation as a private fundraising organization.
The National Park Foundation's success is measured entirely by the benefit we bring to our nation's National Parks.
organization.description: The National Park Foundation provides vital funding for National Park programs that enhance the visitor experience but fall outside the reach of Federal spending.

organization.name: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF HOME BUILDERS OF THE UNITED STATES
Vietnam Veterans Memorial Fund, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Vietnam Veterans Memorial Fund, began in 1979, was started by Vietnam War Veteran Jan Scruggs. The Wall, dedicated in 1982, serves as a means of healing and closure for the many war veterans and families of those who were unable to make it back safely from Vietnam. Since 1979, VVMF has evolved into an organization that strives to better the education on the Vietnam War throughout the nation, preserves the spirit of reverence for our veterans through various ceremonies, and also aids in the healing process for veterans and families with our many programs.
organization.description: To preserve the legacy of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial, to educate and to promote healing from the effects of the Vietnam War.

organization.name: Points of Light Institute
organization.missionStatement:
On August 1, 2007, Points of Light Foundation and Hands On Network merged into a single organization with a shared vision and a shared set of goals.
This united organization is now called Points of Light Institute and embraces a new vision for transformation:
One day every person will discover their power to make a difference, creating healthy communities in vibrant democracies around the world.
Points of Light Institute has three main goals:
Citizen Action: Create an engaged citizenry where every individual has the opportunity to make a difference through meaningful civic engagement.
Civic Infrastructure: Develop a civic infrastructure equipped with the resources, tools, and knowledge to create change in communities.
Campaigns for Impact: Demonstrate the power of citizens actively engaged in changing our world and solving problems.
Points of Light Institute advances innovative civic change strategies.
To realize this new vision and to achieve these goals, Points of Light Institute supports a portfolio of branded business units that enable people a variety of ways to act upon their power to make a change.
Points of Light Institute supports these efforts through incubation, back-office support services, sector thought leadership, and public policy development.
The Institute also supports emerging new business units and entrepreneurial ventures through partnership, collaboration, and incubation that advance a variety of forms of civic engagement.
Generated by Points of Light Institute:
HandsOn Network is the leading business unit within the Points of Light Institute portfolio and is the activating arm. HandsOn Network inspires, equips, and mobilizes people to take action that changes the world. At the center of the network are our 370 affiliates serving 83% of the American population and 12 international communities. It is also a &#8220;network of networks&#8221; that includes our partnering nonprofits, government agencies, faith-based organizations, and companies seeking to engage in service.
MissionFish is a social enterprise of the Points of Light Institute, representing another form of how we support people's power to change the world. It does this by enabling people to sell or purchase products through eBay to benefit the nonprofit causes they care about. MissionFish has raised more than $125 million charitable dollars for over 15,000 nonprofits worldwide.
A Convergence of Now Our collective network- now the largest in the nation - manages millions of volunteers and 50,000 volunteer driven community impact projects annually around the country. We are unleashing the power of people to solve problems and build communities. We are generating ideas, telling the story and creating new tools for change-making.
Why Now? Once in a generation, a seismic shift occurs that fundamentally transforms our civic landscape. In the world of volunteerism and civic action, that moment is now. Cultural shifts are opening new avenues to address the challenges of volunteerism. Across America, technology-driven social networking and mobile technology are redefining the nature of interaction, shaping a new culture of communication. There is a resurgence of interest in the inner workings of government, schools, community and social change. There is a new energy around the idea of individual and collective exchange to create value and meaning that results in safe, connected and healthy communities. People are starting to ask how they can be involved and what they can do.
What We Do We ensure that there are volunteer and community participation opportunities for people through the country and increasingly, around the world. We engage individuals, corporations, nonprofits and government institutions to incubate, develop and mobilize collaborative citizen leadership, thus creating innovative, actionable solutions that can be replicated across the world. We empower individuals to create real-time community solutions which drive systemic change.
organization.description: The Foundation works to engage and support volunteer centers, companies, and nonprofits in sustaining and developing volunteer programs that educate and inspire.

organization.name: Center for American Progress
organization.missionStatement: CAP creates a modern identity for progressivism , generates original policy proposals, and uses sophisticated communications tools to maximize our impact.
organization.description: Develop and advance an innovative progressive agenda and defend bedrock American values of opportunity, equality, fairness, openness, innovation, and a commitment to the common good.

organization.name: Civil War Preservation Trust
organization.missionStatement: CWPT's Mission: Preservation of America's Civil War battlefields by protecting the land and educating the public about the vital roles those battlefields played in directing the course of our nation's history.
organization.description: The Civil War Preservation Trust is the nation's largest battlefield preservation organization (501 (c)3). Our members have saved over 25,000 acres of hallowed ground in 18 states from development.

organization.name: HOUSING ASSISTANCE COUNCIL
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Housing Assistance Council is to improve housing conditions for the rural poor, with an emphasis on the poorest of the poor in the most rural places.
organization.description: HAC provides financing, technical assistance, training and information to help rural communities build affordable housing.

organization.name: Partners of the Americas, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: POA believes that working together across borders builds understanding and improves the lives of people in the Western Hemisphere. We create opportunities that inspire hope for all and celebrate the richness of our diversity.
organization.description: POA is the largest volunteer organization working to promote economic and social development in the Western Hemisphere by creating people to people solutions for sustainable development.

organization.name: IFES, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: As one of the world's premier democracy and governance assistance organizations, IFES provides targeted technical assistance to strengthen transitional democracies.
organization.description: IFES is an international, non-profit organization that supports the building of democratic societies.

organization.name: COUNCIL FOR ADVANCEMENT AND SUPPORT OF EDUCATION
National Museum of Women in the Arts, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The National Museum Of Women In The Arts was founded in 1987 by Wilhelmina Cole Hollday to bring recognition to the achievements of women artists of all periods and nationalities by exhibiting, preserving, acquiring, and researching art by women and by educating the public about their achievements.
organization.description: The National Museum Of Women In The Arts was founded in 1987 by Wilhelmina Cole Hollday to bring recognition to the achievements of women artists of all periods and nationalities by exhibiting, preserving, acquiring, and researching art by women and by e

organization.name: NATIONAL COMMUNITY REINVESTMENT COALITION INC
organization.missionStatement: The National Community Reinvestment Coalition's mission is to increase fair and equal access to credit, capital, banking services/products because discrimination is illegal, unjust and detrimental to the economic growth of underserved communities in the U.S. and around the world. NCRC seeks to support, create and implement long-term solutions, which include providing tools and strategies for building community and individual economic well-being.
organization.description: The National Community Reinvestment Coalition is a membership organization which advocates for fair and equal access to credit, capital and other financial services. Our 580 member organizations work to create policies and partnerships that promote economic justice, and build wealth, in low-income and minority communities.

organization.name: NATIONAL ACADEMY OF PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION
organization.missionStatement: Assist federal agencies, congressional committees, state and local governments, civic organizations and institutions overseas through problem-solving, objective research, rigorous analysis, information-sharing, developing strategies for change, and connecting people and ideas.
organization.description: An independent, non-profit organizatin chartered by Congress to improve governance at all levels: local, regional, state, national and international.

organization.name: The Studio Theatre, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
The Studio Theatre's mission is to produce the best in contemporary theatre. Its restless, innovative spirit seeks out new directions and makes The Studio Theatre a leader both in Washington and in the nation. Its four intimate, jewel-like theatres demonstrate its commitment to the primacy of performance and to intimacy between actor and audience. The Studio Theatre chooses to serve a larger audience with a greater number of performances, rather than a greater number of seats. It values the flexibility that its theatres allow to extend the life of productions in-house. Artist-founded and artist-driven, The Studio Theatre demands the highest quality production values, bringing audiences unparalleled artistry in design, directing, and performance. It is committed to producing bold, intelligent writing and to balancing contemporary classics with daring innovations.
The Studio Theatre enriches the breadth and diversity of its programming through two additional producing areas: 2ndstage and Special Events. 2ndstage provides opportunities for emerging and established local and national artists, and our Special Events feature unique productions and one-of-a-kind performers from around the world.
The Acting Conservatory offers rigorous professional theatre training in close partnership with the working artists at The Studio Theatre. This pairing allows students to develop their craft in a challenging and encouraging environment and to learn from the real-world experience of their instructors. A champion in historic preservation and developing found-space theatres, The Studio Theatre is deeply invested in the revitalization of its Logan Circle neighborhood. The Studio Theatre's commitment to artistic excellence serves the diverse communities of the Nation's Capital.
organization.description: The best in contemporary theatre. Nurtures emerging actors through 2ndstage. Trains actors to fullest potential through the Acting Conservatory. Community service programs serve the region's diverse communities.

organization.name: ActionAid USA
organization.missionStatement: ActionAid works with poor and excluded people around the world to fight poverty and the injustices that cause it. Together, we can end poverty.
organization.description: ActionAid International USA is a founding member of ActionAid International, whose vision is a world without poverty in which every person can exercise their right to a life of dignity.

organization.name: American Near East Refugee Aid
organization.missionStatement: ANERA creates opportunity and hope for people in the Middle East by improving health care and education and stimulating job creation.
organization.description: ANERA was founded in 1968 and provides humanitarian aid through health, education and job creation programs, positively effecting the lives 1.5 million people throughout the Middle East.

organization.name: International Executive Service
organization.missionStatement: The International Executive Service Corps is a private not-for-profit organization. Our mission is to contribute to global stability by assisting in the development of free-market economies and democratic societies. We provide expertise to strengthen private sector enterprises and government entities to enable self-sufficiency and participation in the worldwide economy. As a consequence, we also strengthen the U.S. economy through trade, investment and alliances between overseas companies and American businesses.
organization.description: International Executive Service Corps is a private, non-profit economic development organization that provides technical assistance to encourage economic growth in an effort to improve the lives of people in the developing world and emerging democracies.

organization.name: NAFSA ASSOCIATION OF INTERNATIONAL EDUCATORS
organization.missionStatement: NAFSA is an association of individuals worldwide advancing international education and exchange. NAFSA serves its members, their institutions and organizations, and others engaged in international education and exchange and global workforce development. Our members share a belief that international educational exchange advances learning and scholarship, builds respect among different peoples and encourages constructive leadership in a global community.
organization.description: NAFSA: Association of International Educators is the leading association in the field of international education and exchange, promoting the exchange of students and scholars to and from the United States.

organization.name: Heart Rhythm Society, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Heart Rhythm Society is the international leader in education, science and advocacy for cardiac arrhythmia professionals and patients, and the primary information resource on heart rhythm disorders.
organization.description: We restore the rhythm of life. Through research, education and clinical practice we provide life enhancing heart rhythm management and advance the highest standards of care.

organization.name: Hudson Institute, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: We challenge conventional thinking and help manage strategic transitions to the future through interdisciplinary and collaborative studies in defense, international relations, economics, culture, science, technology, and law. Through publications, conferences and policy recommendations, we seek to guide global leaders in government and business.
organization.description: Hudson Institute is a non-partisan policy research organization dedicated to innovative research and analysis that promotes global security, prosperity, and freedom.

organization.name: PARTNERSHIP FOR PUBLIC SERVICE INC
organization.missionStatement:
Building, energizing and maintaining a high quality workforce is the key to success for any organization -- and the federal government is no different. To revitalize public service and improve government performance, the Partnership pursues three strategic goals:
Building Communities of Support Fueling Innovation Securing the Right Talent
organization.description: The Partnership for Public Service is a non-partisan, non-profit organization that works to revitalize federal government by inspiring a new generation to serve and by transforming the way government works.

organization.name: AMERICAN INTERNATIONAL HEALTH ALLIANCE INC
organization.missionStatement: AIHA provides a framework for U.S. medical professionals to volunteer in a long-term, meaningful, results-oriented program assisting medical professionals in developing countries and/or countries in transition to improve the quality of their healthcare delivery systems.
organization.description: The American International Health Alliance (AIHA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to advancing global health through professional, volunteer, peer-to-peer partnerships.

organization.name: FAMILIES U S A FOUNDATION INC
Action Against Crime and Violence Education Fund
organization.missionStatement:
As police leaders, prosecutors and crime survivors, we struggle every day against crime and its devastating impact. We are determined to see that dangerous criminals are arrested and put behind bars. But policing and prosecution alone leave us stuck on a treadmill, with more kids becoming criminals to replace those we lock up.
There is no substitute for tough law enforcement. But neither is there any excuse for failing to invest today in the programs we know can prevent crime tomorrow. That's why over 3,000 law enforcement leaders and crime survivors have come together to form Fight Crime: Invest in Kids, a national non-profit with state offices in California, Illinois, Maine, Michigan, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, Pennsylvania, and Washington.
organization.description: Through its national Fight Crime: Invest in Kids program, the Fund aims to help the public and policy-makers understand that investments that give children the right start in life. Early childhood education and after-school youth programs are the most effective way to reduce crime and make all of us safer.

organization.name: N Street Village, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: N Street Village provides a therapeutic community, encompassing a day center, a night shelter, case management, transitional housing, group homes, recovery housing, employment and vocation training, and medical services. Through each area of our services, homeless women are assisted in developing necessary skills abilities and resources to claim their highest quality of life and maximum level of self-sufficiency.
organization.description: N Street Village empowers homeless and low-income women to claim their highest quality of life by offering a broad spectrum of services and advocacy in an atmosphere of dignity and respect.

organization.name: Joseph P. Kennedy, Jr. Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The major objectives of The Joseph P. Kennedy, Jr. Foundation are to improve the way society deals with its citizens who have mental retardation, and to help identify and disseminate ways to prevent the causes of mental retardation.
organization.description: A leader in the field of mental retardation, The Joseph P. Kennedy, Jr. Foundation, established in 1946 by Ambassador and Mrs. Joseph P. Kennedy, honors their eldest son who was killed in World War II.

organization.name: House of Ruth
organization.missionStatement:
House of Ruth helps women, children and families in greatest need and with very limited resources build safe, stable lives and achieve their highest potential. At our many locations in Washington, DC, we serve women, children and families who are striving to overcome childhood trauma, domestic violence, homelessness, mental health disorders, and substance abuse. House of Ruth provides nurturing, structured, safe housing and caring, consistent, individualized services in order to capitalize on the participants' strengths such as courage and resiliency.
House of Ruth's programs and services are focused on creating and sustaining positive change for the women, children and families we serve. Our guiding principles are as follows:
Establish an ongoing therapeutic relationship with each person in order to make positive change possible. Interactions are caring, consistent, respectful and responsive. Support every participant and capitalize on their strengths to achieve their individualized outcomes: stable housing, trauma recovery, mental health, addiction recovery, employment and abuse-free relationships. Develop the most effective interventions and carry them out with the highest ethical standards. Provide an environment that is nurturing, consistent, structured and safe. Attract, develop and retain proficient, skilled, supportive staff. Serve as a conduit for caring members of the community to effectively assist women, children and families who are homeless and abused. Exercise excellent stewardship of and accountability for private donations and public funds. Maintain our financial stability and cost-efficiency. Sustain an unwavering focus on our mission, principles and vision and the women, children and families we serve.
House of Ruth's vision is to enable the largest number of people we serve to achieve stable housing, trauma recovery, mental health, addiction recovery, employment and abuse-free relationships. To achieve this vision House of Ruth will:
Seek continuous improvement by identifying and incorporating proven interventions and locating and employing staff and clinicians with specialized skills. Achieve measurable successes by identifying and employing strategies to fully engage participants in the positive change process. Increase staff's effectiveness in consistently using proven interventions.
organization.description: House of Ruth assists 600 women and children daily in the District of Columbia in overcoming homelessness and abuse to achieve stability and independence.

organization.name: American Rivers, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: American Rivers, founded in 1973, is dedicated to protecting and restoring healthy natural rivers and the variety of life they sustain,for the benefit of people, fish, and wildlife.
organization.description: Working to protect and restore America's rivers and foster a river stewardship ethic; ensuring safe drinking water, recreational opportunities, and preserving fish and wildlife habitat.

organization.name: DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA PRIMARY CARE ASSOCIATION
organization.missionStatement: The mission of DCPCA is to facilitate the development and maintenance of an effective, integrated primary health care delivery system in the District of Columbia -- a system that guarantees access to primary health care and eliminates disparities in health outcomes.
organization.description: To facilitate the development and maintenance of an effective, integrated primary health care delivery system in the District of Columbia.

organization.name: District Of Columbia College Access Program
organization.missionStatement: The mission of DC-CAP is to encourage and enable DC public high school students to enter and graduate from college. The need for the DC College Access Program is urgent. Historically, less than 55 percent of D.C. public high school freshmen earn a high school diploma and only one-third pursue any type of post-secondary education. Only 15% of these students graduate from college. The goal of DC-CAP is to work with and convince at-risk students that college is a viable option that they can pursue with the proper motivation, guidance, and financial assistance.
organization.description: DC-CAP works to increase the number of DC public high school students who attend and graduate from college by providing counseling and financial assistance.

organization.name: Center for International Private Enterprise Inc
organization.missionStatement: To strengthen democracy around the globe through private enterprise and market-oriented reform.
organization.description: Strengthening democracy around the globe through private enterprise and market-oriented reform.

organization.name: American International Health Alliance
organization.missionStatement:
AIHA, its partnerships, and programs represent one of the US healthcare sector's most coordinated responses to a broad range of issues affecting global health. Our programs contribute to sustainable change by providing the management and programmatic support to help donor institutions and health systems coordinate other forms of government or privately-sponsored development assistance.
AIHA's technical assistance model provides an underlying structure that supports health reform, offering counsel and guidance based on five key pillars that serve as the basic framework for our programmatic work:
introducing new models of care and services mobilizing communities for change building sustainable capacity among healthcare practitioners furthering the development of health-related professions expanding knowledge through effective dissemination of successful programs
Clinical and administrative programs established through AIHA partnerships and programs are more sustainable because the partner-recipients identify key issues and create their own solutions. Particular attention is focused on the need for low-tech, economically-viable programs that increase productivity and quality of care without imposing new burdens that would impede long-term success and feasibility. Our goal is to improve output and effectiveness to such a degree that the provision of essential health-related programs and services can be sustained independently within the host community
organization.description: The American International Health Alliance is a nonprofit organization working to advance global health by helping communities and nations with limited resources build sustainable institutional and human resource capacity. Through twinning partnerships and other programs, we provide technical assistance using the knowledge and skills of experienced physicians, nurses, administrators, educators, allied health professionals, and civic leaders. Our programs address critical issues such as HIV/AIDS and other infectious diseases, maternal and child health, primary care, emergency and disaster preparedness, and health professions education and development

organization.name: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF STATE COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES
AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION AND SUBSIDIARY
CONSORTIUM FOR ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESS STRENGTHENING
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE UNIV AND LAND-GRANT COLLEGES
NATIONAL CAUCUS AND CENTER ON BLACK AGED INC
Rural Community Assistance Program
organization.missionStatement: The U.S. Census indicates that at least one million rural Americans still lack indoor plumbing, while millions more live with inadequate sanitation systems creating circumstances that threaten drinking water, public health and the environment. Water infrastructure directly affects the quality of human life. Poor water and waste infrastructure can also stifle community development. For 30 years, RCAP has provided comprehensive rural development solutions to more than 3 million rural residents. Our participatory community capacity building strategy facilitates the engagement of low-income and minority communities in the socio-economic revitalization of their communities. This approach encourages local community leaders to develop the knowledge, skills, and motivation to sustain development efforts.
organization.description: RCAP is a national organization providing research, policy analysis, outreach, training and technical assistance to approximately 2,000 small, rural, predominately economically disadvantaged, communities a year.

organization.name: Jobs with Justice Education Fund
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1987, JwJ's mission is to improve working people's standard of living, fight for job security, and protect workers' right to organize. JwJ's core belief is that in order to be successful, workers' rights struggles have to be part of a larger campaign for economic and social justice. To that end, JwJ has created a network of local coalitions that connect labor, faith-based, community, and student organizations to work together on workplace and community social justice campaigns.
organization.description: Jobs with Justice is a national campaign for workers' rights and economic justice.

organization.name: International Center for Not for Profit Law USA, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The International Center for Not-for-Profit Law (ICNL) is an international organization that facilitates and supports the development of civil society. Its purpose is to assist the creation and improvement of laws and regulatory systems that permit, encourage, and regulate voluntary, independent, not-for-profit organizations (including voluntary associations, societies, foundations, charitable organizations, etc.) in countries around the world. ICNL has worked in over 80 countries worldwide.
organization.description: ICNL assists in the creation and improvement of laws and regulatory systems that permit, encourage, and regulate voluntary, independent, not-for-profit organizations (NGOs) around the world.

organization.name: CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER BOARD OF STANDARDS INC
Joint Center For Political And Economic Studies, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Joint Center's mission is to inform and illuminate the nation's major public policy debates through research, analysis, and information dissemination in order to improve the socioeconomic status of black Americans and other minorities; expand their effective participation in the political and public policy arenas; and promote communication and relationships across racial and ethnic lines to strengthen the nation's pluralistic society.
organization.description: The Joint Center is the nation's premier think tank focusing on issues of concern to African Americans and other people of color.

organization.name: Home Care Partners, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Home Care Partners is a non-profit organization, founded in 1957, whose mission is to provide high quality supportive home care services, including personal care, light housekeeping, meal preparation, and light housekeeping to elderly and disabled individuals, regardless of their ability to pay. Home Care Partners also provides training so that interested residents of the community can train to become certified home care aides.
organization.description: To provide supportive home care services to elderly and disabled individuals in order to help them to remain in their own homes in the community.

organization.name: COUNCIL FOR EXCELLENCE IN GOVERNMENT
organization.description: The Council for Excellence in Government works to improve the performance of government; and government's place in the lives and esteem of American citizens.

organization.name: The National Alliance to End Homelessness, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Alliance represents a united effort to address the root causes of homelessness and challenge society's acceptance of homelessness as an inevitable by-product of American life. Guiding our work is the Ten Year Plan to End Homelessness. The Ten Year Plan identifies our nation's current weaknesses in addressing the problem and lays out practical steps that our nation can take to change our present course and truly end homelessness within ten years.
organization.description: The National Alliance to End Homelessness is dedicated to solving the problem of homelessness and to preventing its continued growth.

organization.name: Coalition for the Homeless, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Coalition for the homeless was founded in 1979 and incorporated as a nonprofit in the District of Columbia in 1981. The mission of the Coalition is to assist the homeless and persons who are at risk of becoming homeless to obtain permanent housing and become self sufficient.
organization.description: The Coalition for the Homeless provides shelter, transitional and permanent housing, substance abuse counseling, employment placement assistance, and supportive social services to homeless men and families.

organization.name: American Society of Civil Engineers Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The ASCE Foundation provides funding and resources in support of civil engineering generally, and specifically through: promoting greater public understanding and appreciation of civil engineering; honoring excellence in engineering; encouraging students to study civil engineering; promoting innovation and research in engineering and construction; and promoting sustainable development.
organization.description: The ASCE Foundation's mission is to generate resources for the civil engineering profession.

organization.name: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGES FOR TEACHER EDUCATION
National Gay and Lesbian Task Force Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The Task Force is the organization that builds grassroots political power of the LGBT community in order to attain complete equality.
organization.description: The Task Force is the organization that builds grassroots political power of the LGBT community in order to attain complete equality.

organization.name: Economic Policy Institute
organization.missionStatement: Economic Policy Institute is a nonprofit, nonpartisan think tank that seeks to broaden the public discussion of strategies to achieve a prosperous and fair economy. EPI searches for and promotes policies that generate jobs and incomes that raise the living standards of American families.
organization.description: The Economic Policy Institute's mission is to inform people and empower them to seek solutions that will ensure broadly shared prosperity and opportunity. EPI was founded in 1986 by Lester Thurow, Robert Reich, Robert Kuttner, Ray Marshall, Jeff Faux and Barry Bluestone to examine current and proposed policies from the perspective of middle- and low-income families.

organization.name: National Coalition on Black Civic Participation, Inc
organization.missionStatement: The National Coalition strives to create an enlightened community by building institutional capacity at both the national and local levels that provides and develops African-American leadership. By educating, organizing and mobilizing citizens in our communities, the Coalition seeks to encourage full participation in a barrier-free democratic process. Through educational programs and leadership training, the Coalition works to expand, strengthen and empower our communities to make voting and civic participation a cultural responsibility and tradition.
organization.description: NCBCP is a nonpartisan, membership organization dedicated to increasing African American participation in civil society and overcoming institutional barriers that hinder political, social and economic growth.

organization.name: Public Education Network
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Public Education Network is to build public demand and mobilize resourcesfor quality public education for all children through a national constituency of local education funds and inviduals.
organization.description: The Public Education Network works through its local members to engage the public and increase education funding in many of our nation's poorest public school districts.

organization.name: AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety
organization.missionStatement: The purpose of the AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety is to reduce the toll taken by traffic crashes, injuries, and deaths. This objective is achieved through the sponsorship of traffic safety research and, then, through the production and widespread distribution of educational videos, audio tapes, brochures and other materials. The Foundation was established by the American Automobile Association in 1947.
organization.description: The purpose of the AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety is to reduce the toll taken by traffic crashes, injuries, and deaths. This objective is achieved through sponsorship of traffic safety research and development of educational products.

organization.name: American Legislative Exchange Council
organization.missionStatement:
The American Legislative Exchange Council's mission is ...
To advance the Jeffersonian Principles of free markets, limited government, federalism, and individual liberty, through a nonpartisan public-private partnership among America's state legislators, concerned members of the private sector, the federal government, and the general public.
To promote these principles by developing policies that ensure the powers of government are derived from, and assigned to, first the People, then the States, and finally the Federal Government.
To enlist state legislators from all parties and members of the private sector who share ALEC's mission.
To conduct a policy making program that unites members of the public and private sector in a dynamic partnership to support research, policy development, and dissemination activities.
To prepare the next generation of political leadership through educational programs that promote the principles of Jeffersonian democracy, which are necessary for a free society.
organization.description: ALEC is the largest individual membership organization for state legislators with over 2,000 members in all 50 states and over 300 corporations, associations, and foundations.

organization.name: NARAL PRO-CHOICE AMERICA FOUNDATION
