organization.missionStatement: To support, as a fundamental right and value, a woman's freedom to make personal decisions regarding the full range of reproductive choices through education, training, organizing, legal action and public policy.
organization.description: NARAL Pro-Choice America Foundation is working to build an engaged pro-choice citizenry that will protect a woman's right to choose and improve reproductive health care options and accessibility by means of strategic education, communication, research, public policy and grassroots programs.

organization.name: National AIDS Fund
organization.missionStatement: Twenty years ago, the National AIDS Fund (NAF) was founded to reduce the incidence and impact of HIV/AIDS by promoting leadership and generating resources for effective community responses to the epidemic. Together with our expanding network of Community Partnerships, NAF has marshaled and invested over $150 million in the United States to combat the AIDS epidemic. Last year, nearly $9 million in national and local funding was directed to over 400 community-based programs through our Community Partnerships. NAF was recently awarded four stars for financial efficiency and effectiveness &#8212;the highest possible&#8212;by Charity Navigator. Through an innovative approach, focusing on its priority initiatives &#8211; sustained leadership and community outreach &#8211; NAF is the dynamic center for community response, funding, and prevention education and a trailblazer in translating the impact of this work into the public well being.
organization.description: The National AIDS Fund was founded in 1988 to reduce the incidence and impact of HIV/AIDS by promoting leadership and generating resources for effective community responses to the epidemic.

organization.name: FOUNDATIONS FOR HOME AND COMMUNITY INC
HOWARD ROAD ACADEMY PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL INC
PUBLIC HEALTH FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: PHF is building capacity and infrastructure of organizations that protect the public's health.
organization.description: PHF is building capacity and infrastructure of organizations that protect the public's health.

organization.name: DISTILLED SPIRITS COUNCIL OF THE UNITED STATES INC
AMERICAN COUNCIL OF ENGINEERING COMPANIES INC
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF REGULATORY UTILITY COMMISSIONERS
Lawyers Committee for Civil Rights Under Law
organization.missionStatement:
While discrimination based on race, gender, and national origin persists, the Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights Under Law has made substantial gains over the past decade in guaranteeing constitutional protections for Americans in all areas of our society. The Lawyers' Committee's representation -- in the courts, as the people's advocate before government bodies, and in educating the public about crucial civil rights issues--has given hope to millions of Americans and strengthened opportunities for all.
The Lawyers' Committee is a national, non-partisan, non-profit organization. We were formed in 1963 at the request of President John F. Kennedy to marshal the resources of the legal community to address our nation's pressing civil rights needs. For nearly four decades, the Lawyers' Committee has worked to rebuild communities, improve educational opportunities for young people, promote fairness in the workplace, foster fair housing and economic opportunities, improve the environmental health of contaminated communities, and foster full participation of all citizens in our nation's democratic institutions.
Leading representatives of the American bar -- including partners at major law firms, general counsel of corporations, law school deans, and individual attorneys -- are integral to both the governance and execution of the Lawyers' Committee's work. These bar leaders serve on the Board of Directors and Trustees of the Lawyers' Committee and provide countless hours of pro bono service as co-counsel in path-breaking civil rights cases. Our accomplishments are realized through the Committee's network of more than 100 major law firms and thousands of individual lawyers nationwide. When combined with the resources of the eight local, independently financed and governed Lawyers' Committees -- with their own extensive attorney networks -- we represent the largest civil rights legal formation in the United States.
The Lawyers' Committee's legacy is intertwined with the landmark victories and accomplishments of the civil rights movement -- from the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Voting Rights Act of 1965, and the Fair Housing Act of 1968 to the Civil Rights Act of 1991 and the National Voter Registration Act of 1993.
organization.description: Represents minorities and women seeking equality in employment, education, housing, voting, environmental justice, community development; helps churches burned by hate crime--Founded by President Kennedy.

organization.name: Initiatives of Change, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Initiatives of Change(IofC) envisions one American community arising out of its wonderfully diverse peoples. To this end, IofC seeks to inspire and equip individuals to bring hope, healing and transformation to communities in America and the world, and to connect communities across race, economic class, faith and other differences to build a more just and inclusive society.
organization.description: A global network open to people of all nationalities, cultures, religions, and beliefs, who work towards change, locally and globally, starting with change in their own lives. Major initiatives include ACTION, the Caux Scholars Program and Hope in the Cities.

organization.name: Brady Center To Prevent Gun Violence
organization.missionStatement: As the largest national, non-partisan, grassroots organization leading the fight to prevent gun violence, The Brady Center to Prevent Gun Violence is dedicated to creating an America free from gun violence, where all Americans are safe at home, at school, at work, and in their communities.
organization.description: The Brady Center to Prevent Gun Violence works to reform the gun industry and educate the public about gun violence through litigation and grassroots mobilization, and works to enact and enforce sensible regulations to reduce gun violence including regulations governing the gun industry.

organization.name: Civicus World Alliance for Citizen Participation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: CIVICUS is an international alliance of civil society organisations, with members in around 100 countries, dedicated to strengthening civil society worldwide. The three major objectives informing the mission of CIVICUS are: - Promoting Civic Existence- to promote the rights of citizens to organise and act collectively towards defining goals for the public good. - Promoting Civic Expression- to increase the effectiveness and improve the governance of civil society organisations, as well as their capacity to set and achieve their individual and collective goals. - Promoting Civic Engagement- to foster interaction between civil society and other institutions in order to increase the voice of citizens in public life. organizations worldwide.
organization.description: CIVICUS is an international alliance dedicated to strengthening civil society and citizen action throughout the world.

organization.name: The Justice Project Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Justice Project is a nonpartisan organization dedicated to fighting injustice and to creating a more humane and just world. Founders of The Justice Project are men and women who as veterans have been willing to risk our lives fighting injustice. Our military experiences have left us with an understanding of human suffering and a desire to leave a legacy of fairness for future generations.
organization.description: The Justice Project uses the tools of social and political change -- public education, coalition building, citizen action and direct political engagement with state and national lawmakers -- to build bipartisan support to fight injustice.

organization.name: Hospice Care of the District of Columbia
organization.missionStatement:
Among the services Hospice Care of DC offers:
Treatment of the patient's physical symptoms and pain by a physician-directed, nurse-coordinated team of health care professionals
Care for the spiritual, psychosocial and emotional pain of patients and families facing death, provided by clergy, social workers and trained volunteers
Emotional support for the patient's family and friends during the illness
Bereavement care for the surviving family and friends after the patient's death
On-call availability of the Hospice team, 24-hours-a-day, seven-days-a-week
Coordination of related services, such as certified nursing assistants, physical, occupational and speech therapists; and others who may be needed to provide comfort and symptom control
Management of medications, medical supplies and equipment related to the patient's terminal illness
Coordination of in-patient care, when appropriate.
organization.description: Hospice Care of DC seeks to provide compassionate care to and assist all terminally ill residents of the District of Columbia to live as fully as possible, while supporting them and their loved ones through a comprehensive program of pain and symptom management, and psychosocial, spiritual, bereavement and volunteer support, and to educate the entire community about end-of-life issues and care.

organization.name: Institute for Local Self Reliance, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Building on a theme of "environmentally sound economic development," ILSR's research and direct work with citizens groups, governments and the private sector has demonstrated over and over how responsible development can improve the bottom line as well as the quality of the environment. Program work varies from direct job creation in communities to public policy research and information dissemination. An overarching theme at ILSR is "Designing Rules as if Community Matters."
organization.description: ILSR works to strengthen communities through research and technical assistance that maximizes the efficient use of local resources.

organization.name: LLEGO THE NATIONAL LATINA-O LESBIAN GAY BISEXUAL AND TRANSGENDER ORG
SOS Children's Village USA, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: We build families for children in need, we help them shape their own futures, and we share in the development of their communities.
organization.description: SOS Children's Villages provides homes and families for orphaned and abandoned children in 132 countries around the world.

organization.name: Religious Coalition for Reproductive Choice Educational Fund
organization.missionStatement: Powerful religious voices are urgently needed to counter the Religious Right's claim to represent all religious values on reproductive issues! As the only coalition of national denominations and faith groups with official pro-choice policies, the Religious Coalition for Reproductive Choice is uniquely qualified to provide the religious voice for choice in the United States. The Religious Coalition's twenty-two affiliates in twenty states work around the clock to mobilize religious pro-choice advocacy. We also maintain a national register of 4,000 Clergy for Choice of many faiths' a key to local organizing and media visibility work. And our People of Color Committee continue to assist us in addressing reproductive health care concerns from their diverse perspectives.
organization.description: The Religious Coalition brings the moral power of religious communities to ensure reproductive choice through education and advocacy.

organization.name: Judge David L. Bazelon Center for Mental Health Law
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Bazelon Center for Mental Health Law is to protect and advance the rights of adults and children who have mental disabilities. The Center envisions an America where people who have mental illnesses or developmental disabilities exercise their own life choices and have access to the resources that enable them to participate fully in their communities.
organization.description: The Bazelon Center conducts legal and policy advocacy to protect children and adults with mental disabilities from discrimination and promote their full participation in community life.

organization.name: National Sleep Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The NSF is dedicated to promoting public understanding of sleep and sleep disorders and to supporting sleep-related education, research and advocacy to improve public health and safety.
organization.description: The NSF is dedicated to promoting public understanding of sleep and sleep disorders and to supporting sleep-related education, research and advocacy to improve public health and safety.

organization.name: National Prostate Cancer Coalition, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The National Prostate Cancer Coalition (NPCC) sets the standard for rapidly reducing the burden of prostate cancer on American men and their families through awareness, outreach, and advocacy.
organization.description: Leading the nation in the fight against prostate cancer through awareness, outreach, and advocacy with award-winning campaigns, lobbying efforts, and the Drive Against Prostate Cancer.

organization.name: CITIZENS FOR RESPONSIBILITY AND ETHICS IN WASHINGTON INC
organization.missionStatement: CREW holds government officials accountable for their actions.
organization.description: CREW uses the legal system to target unethical government conduct.

organization.name: Genocide Intervention Network Inc
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to empower individuals and communities with the tools to prevent and stop genocide.
organization.description: Created to help citizens prevent and stop genocide, the Genocide Intervention Network (GI-Net) will change the way the United States and the international community respond to the world's worst crime.

organization.name: National Arts Strategies, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: NAS was founded by the Ford, Rockefeller, and Mellon Foundations over 20 years ago to stabilize communities of arts organizations throughout the United States. We have worked on multi-year technical assistance and educational programs in 10 cities and conducted educational seminars for over 2000 participants in the United States and abroad. NAS works with governing boards and senior leadership to invest in leaders' development and help them strengthen all areas of planning and operations.
organization.description: NAS strengthens arts organizations and those who lead them with strategic education programs in financial capitalization, technology, mission alignment, and other topics.

organization.name: Association of Science-Technology Centers, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: ASTC is a nonprofit organization of science centers and museums dedicated to furthering the public understanding of science among increasingly divers audiences. ASTC encourages excellence and innovation in informal science learning by serving and linking its members worldwide and advancing their common goals. Through a variety of programs and services, ASTC provides professional development for the science centers within the community at large, and fosters the creation of successful partnerships and collaborations.
organization.description: ASTC is a non-profit organization of science centers and museums dedicated to furthering the public understanding of science among increasingly diverse audiences.

organization.name: Appleseed Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Appleseed Foundation's mission is to build a just society through legal advocacy, community activism, and policy expertise. We work locally to address root causes and produce practical, systemic solutions. We strive for a society in which opportunities are genuine, access to the law is universal and equal, and power is used to advance the public interest
organization.description: The Appleseed Foundation organizes, supports, and assists a national network of sixteen independent centers dedicated to addressing root problems in their communities.

organization.name: EDUCATION & RESEARCH FUND OF EMPLOYEE BENEFIT RESEARCH INSTITUT
organization.missionStatement: The EBRI mission is to contribute to, to encourage, and to enhance the development of sound employee benefit programs and public policy through objective research and education.
organization.description: The Education and Research Fund (ERF), established in 1979, performs the charitable, educational, and scientific functions of the Institute. EBRI-ERF is a tax-exempt organization (under IRC Sec. 501(c)(3)) supported by contributions and grants. EBRI-ERF is not a private foundation (as defined by IRC Sec. 509(a)(3)).EBRI undertakes research and education aimed at enhancing individual health and financial security. It is not organized as a lobbying organization. To accomplish the mission all parties have to be willing to rely upon our work as objective and accurate. EBRI does not represent others or take for or against positions, it does research and education.

organization.name: The American Constitution Society for Law and Policy
organization.missionStatement:
Founded in 2001, ACS is a rapidly growing network of lawyers, law students, scholars, judges, policymakers and other concerned individuals. Our mission is to ensure that fundamental principles of human dignity, individual rights and liberties, genuine equality, and access to justice enjoy their rightful, central place in American law.
ACS aims to revitalize and transform the legal and policy debates occurring in law school classrooms, federal and state courtrooms, legislative hearing rooms and the media. Through student and lawyer chapters all across the country, and programs and projects at both the national and local level, ACS promotes a progressive vision of the Constitution, law and public policy; educates lawyers, law students, decision-makers and the public about the historic basis and vitality of such a vision and its importance for the lives of real people; strengthens the intellectual underpinnings for progressive law and policy in the United States; and continues to build a diverse and dynamic national network.
organization.description: A non-profit, non-partisan, educational organization seeking to revitalize and transform the debate on law and policy in the United States.

organization.name: Hispanic Business College Fund, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Hispanic College Fund's mission is to create a pipeline of talented and career-driven young Hispanics, equip them to succeed in the competitive corporate world allowing them to join the mainstream.
organization.description: The Hispanic College Fund is a national organization promoting business and entrepreneurship by providing need-based scholarships to talented Hispanic students who wish to obtain an undergraduate degree.

organization.name: INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MACHINISTS & AEROSPACE WORKERS
PRINCE GEORGE S AFFORDABLE HOUSING INC
NATIONAL ASSN OF STATE DEPT OF AGRICULTURE
ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC HEALTH INC
CENTER FOR LAW AND SOCIAL POLICY
WINE & SPIRITS WHOLESALERS OF AMERICA INC
BRADY CAMPAIGN TO PREVENT GUN VIOLENCE
America the Beautiful Fund
organization.missionStatement: The America the Beautiful Fund (ABF) was born of a desire to preserve America's natural heritage by assisting community-level programs and projects to save the natural and man-made environment and improve the quality of life. The America the Beautiful Fund now provides support and direction to volunteer community projects in all 50 states, operating as a clearinghouse of ideas for thousands of community projects and as a catalyst for new ones, drawing on a quarter of a century of experience of knowing what works and what does not work.
organization.description: The America the Beautiful Fund (ABF) was born of a desire to preserve America's natural heritage by assisting community-level programs and projects to save the natural and man-made environment and improve the quality of life.

organization.name: Cooperative Development Foundation
organization.missionStatement: Cooperative Development Foundation works throughout the U.S. and internationally to help people help themselves and improve their lives through cooperative solutions. Co-op businesses are an option for self-help and employment. Childcare co-ops, food buying clubs, worker-owned businesses, co-op housing, and credit unions are some examples. In both rural and urban areas, co-ops have empowered people to move from welfare to work, or simply enhance their quality of life.
organization.description: CDF helps people help themselves and improve their lives through co-op solutions. We support community, economic, and social development through co-op enterprises founded on self-help and mutual aid. Long-term solutions.

organization.name: Chorus America
organization.missionStatement: Chorus America's mission is to strengthen choruses and increase appreciation of choral music so that more people are enriched by its beauty and power. Chorus America serves the spectrum of professional, volunteer, children/youth, and symphony/opera choruses. To accomplish its mission, Chorus America provides information, publications, conferences, consulting, training programs, surveys, networking, and awards to support choruses in North America.
organization.description: Chorus America is the service organization for choruses and chorus leaders of all kinds in the US and Canada.

organization.name: National Council of Nonprofit Associations
organization.missionStatement: NCNA advances the vital role and capacity of the nonprofit sector in civil society and supports and gives voice to state and regional associations of nonprofit organizations.
organization.description:
The National Council of Nonprofit Associations (NCNA) is the network of state and regional nonprofit associations serving over 22,000 members in 45 states and the District of Columbia. NCNA links local organizations to a national audience through state associations and helps small and mid-sized nonprofits:
- Manage and lead more effectively - Collaborate and exchange solutions - Save money through group buying opportunities - Engage in critical policy issues affecting the sector - Achieve greater impact in their communities.

organization.name: COUNCIL FOR THE NATL RGSTR OF HLTH SERV PROVIDERS IN PSYCHOLOGY INC
organization.missionStatement: To contribute to the continuous improvement of health services to the public through developing, reviewing and disseminating standards for evaluating credentials of healthcare providers; disseminating information on psychologists; conducting ethics programs; and evaluating educational programs that enhance the education, training, and delivery of services by psychologists and other healthcare providers.
organization.description: Credentialing of doctorate level psychologists who meet our minimum standards. Hurricane Katrina relief to affected Registrants by waiving FY06 renewal fee, assisting with licensure mobility in other locations, and assisting other organizations with license verifications.

organization.name: Americans for Peace Now , Inc.
organization.missionStatement: APN's mission is to help Israel and Israel's Peace Now movement achieve a comprehensive political settlement of the Arab-Israeli conflict consistent with Israel's long-term security needs and its Jewish and democratic values. The Israel Defense Forces reserve commanders and officers who founded Peace Now understood that the best guarantee for Israel's security is peace with its Arab neighbors. Today, Peace Now is Israel's largest, most influential peace organization. It remains committed to realizing peace with security between Israel, the Palestinians, and the Arab states by supporting the peace process and though programs educating and bringing together individuals on both sides.
organization.description: Educates Americans about the Middle East peace process to create an informed and empowered pro-peace American public. Funds Israel's premier grassroots peace movement, Peace Now.

organization.name: Habitat For Humanity International Inc
organization.missionStatement: Habitat for Humanity is a nonprofit, ecumenical Christian housing ministry dedicated to eliminating substandard housing and homelessness worldwide and to making adequate, affordable shelter a matter of conscience and action. Habitat invites people from all faiths and walks of life to work together in partnership, building houses with families in need.
organization.description: As a local affiliate of Habitat for Humanity International, we are a nonprofit, ecumenical Christian ministry building simple, decent, affordable housing in partnership with people in need of adequate shelter.

organization.name: Anti-Slavery International, Inc. DBA Free the Slaves
organization.missionStatement: Free the Slaves works to free the 27 million people in slavery around the world today, help them rebuild their lives, and end slavery once and for all.
organization.description: Free the Slaves is a non-partisan, non-profit organization devoted to ending slavery world-wide.

organization.name: PARKINSONS ACTION NETWORK FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement:
PAN serves as the voice of Parkinson?s disease (PD) on numerous public policy issues affecting the Parkinson?s community. In addition to PAN?s work on National Institutes of Health (NIH) funding and research, the Parkinson?s community is a powerful voice on many crucial issues including Parkinson?s-specific programs at the U.S. Departments of Defense and Veterans Affairs, Health and Human Services (HHS) programs (Medicare and Social Security), Food and Drug Administration (FDA) drug approval issues, and PAN?s continuing struggle to achieve freedom for stem cell research.
PAN has established a national Grassroots Advocacy Program that includes over 160 grassroots volunteer leaders. These coordinators direct a network of several thousand advocates who truly make PAN successful. The advocates take part in actions that include calling, writing or emailing their elected officials, but the possibilities are and always have been endless.
organization.description: PAN is the unified education and advocacy voice of the Parkinson's community--more than one million Americans and their families.

organization.name: DC Heritage Tourism Coalition, Inc., dba Cultural Tourism DC
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1996 and incorporated in 1999, Cultural Tourism DC (CTdc) strenghtens the image and economy of Washington, DC, neighborhood by neighborhood , by linking more than 185 DC cultural and neighborhood organizations with partners in tourism, hospitality, government, and business.
organization.description: CTdc offers an innovative model for maximizing the economic impact of cultural tourism in urban neighborhoods and helps residents and tourist discover and experience Washington's authentic arts and culture.

organization.name: Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia
organization.missionStatement: The Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia was formed to "provide legal aid and counsel to indigent persons in civil law matters and to encourage measures by which the law may better protect and serve their needs." The Legal Aid Society works to ensure that all of the District's residents have equal and meaningful access to justice.
organization.description: The Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia represents poor individuals and families in civil legal cases.

organization.name: AMERICAS BLOOD CENTERS FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: To fund education and promotion programs to raise public awareness of the nation?s need for a safe and stable blood supply and to increase volunteer participation of blood donors today and in the future.
organization.description: Formed in 1997, The Foundation for America?s Blood Centers is a 501 (c) (3) public education organization dedicated to helping ensure a safe and adequate blood supply for all Americans.

organization.name: National Low Income Housing Coalition and Low Income Housing
organization.missionStatement: Established in 1974, the NLIHC is solely dedicated to ending America's affordable housing crisis. NLIHC is committed to educating, organizing, and advocating to ensure decent, affordable housing within healthy neighborhoods for everyone, through providing information, formulating policy, and educating the public on housing needs and the strategies for solutions. Through forums, network building, timely and informative publications, and its Web presence, NLIHC sustains a national network dedicated to affordable housing and healthy communities at state and national levels. NLIHC is also committed to ensuring the participation of low-income people and has established a Scholarship Fund to underwrite their participation.
organization.description: The NLIHC is solely dedicated to ending America's affordable housing crisis through educating, organizing, and advocating to ensure decent affordable housing within healthy neighborhoods.

organization.name: CENTER FOR THE STUDY OF SOCIAL POLICY
The Consortium for Services To Homeless Families
organization.missionStatement: The Consortium for Services to Homeless Families (ConServe) is a nonprofit organization that exists to assist low-income and homeless families achieve their highest level of self-sufficiency through an array of services that are based on a holistic approach and are tailored to meet the needs of families, individuals, and communities. Services include housing assistance, support services, referral services, employment training and education, employment counseling, and emergency assistance. ConServe was created in 1986, as a consortium of service providers, to design alternatives to the existing delivery system for low-income and homeless families. Since that time, ConServe has evolved into a direct service organization that, through an innovative rental assistance program combined with necessary and complimentary support services, places families in situations that give them tools to obtain and maintain independent living. These services have enabled over 1,000 families to move from crisis situations to self-sufficient lifestyles in private rental housing. ConServe remains in existence to serve, in addition to the 7,500 homeless families, the 40,000 families that live in doubled-up or tripled-up situations and the 24,000 families that spend more than 50% of their income on rent.
organization.description: The Consortium for Services to Homeless Families (ConServe) is a nonprofit organization that exists to assist low-income and homeless families achieve their highest level of self-sufficiency through an array of services that are based on a holistic appro

organization.name: International Downtown Assoc
organization.missionStatement: Through its network of committed individuals, its rich body of knowledge, and its unique capacity to nurture community-building partnerships, IDA is a guiding force in creating healthy and dynamic centers that anchor the well being of towns, cities and regions of the world.
organization.description: IDA is a world leader of and champion for vital and livable urban centers.

organization.name: DC Bar Pro Bono Program
organization.missionStatement: The D.C. Bar Pro Bono Program's primary mission is to train and mobilize attorneys licensed to practice law in Washington, D.C. to provide pro bono legal services. The D.C. Bar Pro Bono Program works to ensure that low-income individuals have access to justice regardless of their inability to retain legal counsel. Our program provides them with something that they simply cannot afford: an opportunity to sit with a licensed, experienced attorney who can listen, sort through their legal issues, and advocate on their behalf through a complex legal process to remedy the situation and bring them relief. In addition to individuals, the D.C. Bar Pro Bono Program also provides legal assistance to community-based nonprofit organizations working to revitalize the District?s economically distressed neighborhoods. Our volunteer attorneys help organizations to develop facilities that provide a variety of services for low-income individuals, and also improve commercial corridors in distressed communities. Although we are affiliated with the District of Columbia Bar, we are not funded by Bar member dues. The D.C. Bar Pro Bono Program relies on exclusively charitable and volunteer support to deliver thousands of hours of free legal assistance annually. Our work has earned us a national reputation as an outstanding and effective program.
organization.description: The D.C. Bar Pro Bono Program recruits, trains, and mobilizes volunteer attorneys to provide free legal services to low-income persons and nonprofits in Washington, DC.

organization.name: District of Columbia Coalition Against Domestic Violence
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the DC Coalition Against Domestic Violence is to eradicate all types of relationship violence by unifying systems through advocacy, public awareness, technical assistance, training and research, to shape a coordinated community response that ensures the safety, security, and justice needs of domestic violence victims.
organization.description: DCCADV leads citywide, collaborative anti-domestic violence efforts through public policy, public awareness, training, and relief services that reach more than 10,000 people each year.

organization.name: American Council of the Blind
organization.missionStatement: The American Council of the Blind strives to increase the independence, security, equality of opportunity and quality of life for all blind and visually impaired people.
organization.description: The American Council of the Blind is the nation's leading membership organization of blind and visually impaired people. It was founded in 1961 and incorporated in the District of Columbia.

organization.name: WORKER RIGHTS CONSORTIUM
organization.missionStatement: The WRC helps to enforce the manufacturing codes of conduct of more Through the leverage of more than 100 afiliate schools, the WRC seeks to help workers gain greater respect for their rights and real improvements in their conditions of work.
organization.description: WRC helps enforce codes of conduct for more than 100 affiliate colleges and universities to promote better working conditions in the manufacture of licensed apparel

organization.name: The Justice Project Education Fund, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Justice Project Education Fund, a 501(c)(3) organization, works in partnership with The Justice Project, a 501(c)(4) organization, to address unfairness and inaccuracy in the American criminal justice system.
organization.description: The Justice Project Education Fund is a non-profit organization that increases public awareness and reaffirms America's core commitment to fairness and accuracy in the criminal justice system.

organization.name: The Free Iraq Foundation
organization.description: The Iraq Foundation is a non-profit, non-governmental organization working for democracy and human rights in Iraq, and for a better international understanding of Iraq's potential as a contributor to political stability and economic progress in the Middle East.

organization.name: CENTER FOR RESPONSIVE POLITICS
organization.missionStatement: Campaign contributions and lobbying influence nearly every policy decision that affects Americans--from their health care options to student loans and the cost of gas. CRP is the only non-partisan, independent, free source of information about how money influences federal elections and policy.
organization.description: The Center for Responsive Politics is the leading research organization tracking money's effects on federal elections and public policy. The Center's non-partisan work is aimed at creating a more educated voter, an involved citizenry and a more responsive government.

organization.name: MOSAICA INC
organization.missionStatement:
Mosaica: The Center for Nonprofit Development and Pluralism is a multicultural nonprofit that provides tools to other nonprofits to build just, inclusive, and thriving communities and societies. Its special commitment is to strengthen and support entities committed to serving and empowering those whose voices are least likely to be heard when public policies are adopted and resources allocated.
A national organization established in 1994 in the District of Columbia, Mosaica: - Helps nonprofit organizations become stronger and more effective through training and facilitation, individual consultation, evaluation, and easy-to-use "how to" guides. - Links the nonprofit, public, and private sectors in ways that strengthen local communities and enrich American society. - Helps individuals and groups develop the skills to bridge racial, ethnic, and economic differences and work effectively in multicultural societies.
organization.description: Mosaica: The Center for Nonprofit Development and Pluralism is a multicultural nonprofit that provides tools to other nonprofits to build just, inclusive, and thriving communities and societies.

organization.name: NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to increase the number of high-performing charter schools available to all families, particularly low-income and minority families who currently don&#8217;t have access to quality public schools.&#160;
organization.description: The National Alliance for Public Charter Schools is a national nonprofit organization committed to advancing the charter school movement.

organization.name: Moroccan-American Center for Policy Inc
organization.missionStatement: Is the primary NGO advocating for Moroccan-US relations across issues ranging from foreign assistance and economic cooperation to concerns for regional stability, economic growth, and promotion of mutual interests in the MENA region.
organization.description: Provides information, research, events, and programs that increase understanding of the importance of the Moroccan-US relationship and the means to enhance its effectiveness.

organization.name: Moroccan-American Trade and Ivestment Council Inc
organization.missionStatement: Provides research, insights, and contacts for building successful business relations between Morocco and the U.S.
organization.description: American NGO promoting bilateral trade and investment relations focusing on key sectors: tourism real estate development, IT, manufacturing, and value-added commodities and products.

organization.name: Center for Women's Business Research
organization.missionStatement: Since 1989, Center for Women's Business Research, founded as the National Foundation for Women Business Owners,has provided original, groundbreaking research to document the economic and social contributions of women-owned firms; consulting and public relations services to maximize the benefits of this knowledge; and leadership development for women who own growing enterprises.
organization.description: Center for Women's Business Research, founded as The National Foundation for Women Business Owners, a nonprofit research institute, is the premier source of knowledge on women business owners and their enterprises worldwide.

organization.name: ASSOCIATION FOR WOMEN IN SCIENCE INC
organization.missionStatement: We create opportunities and strive to break down barriers to help women in STEM achieve their full potential.
organization.description: The Association for Women in Science (AWIS) is a national advocacy organization representing the interests of women in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) across all disciplines and employment sectors.

organization.name: GENERATIONS UNITED INC
organization.missionStatement: To improve the lives of children, youth, and older people through intergenerational collaboration, public policies, and programs.
organization.description: To act as a catalyst that fosters innovation in programs and policies that grow and lead the intergenerational field.

organization.name: GLOBAL AIDS ALLIANCE
organization.missionStatement:
GAA's mission is to galvanize the political will and financial resources needed to slow, and ultimately stop, the global AIDS crisis and address its impacts on poor countries hardest hit by the epidemic.
<p>Founded in 2001, we have carved out a leadership role in shaping AIDS policy discussions and mobilizing coalition-based campaigns to break through bureaucratic inaction and speed the pace of the global response to HIV/AIDS.
<p>GAA has achieved considerable success in increasing funding and influencing AIDS policy?earning a well-deserved reputation for holding decision-makers accountable and encouraging concerned citizens to demand political action. We have also established strong working relationships with major stakeholders, including the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, TB and Malaria, UNAIDS, UNICEF, and the World Health Organization, as well as with key decision-makers in the U.S. Congress and United Nations.
organization.description: The Global AIDS Alliance seeks to mobilize a comprehensive and compassionate response to the global HIV/AIDS crisis and ensure universal access to prevention, treatment, and care.

organization.name: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY OF STATE ARTS AGENCIES
organization.missionStatement: NASAA believes the arts have an essential role to play in American democracy. NASAA's mission is to strengthen state arts agencies by representing their individual and collective interests, empowering their work through knowledge, and advancing the arts as an essential public benefit. NASAA provides advocacy, research, training and networking services to state arts agencies and their constituents to help them serve the public and nurture the arts in every state.
organization.description: NASAA is the membership organization of the nation's state arts agencies - a national, nonprofit association that champions public support for the arts in America.

organization.name: Youth Service America
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1986, YSA's mission is to expand the impact of the youth service movement with communities, schools, corporations, and governments.
organization.description: YOUTH SERVICE AMERICA (YSA) is a resource center that partners with thousands of organizations committed to increasing the quality and quantity of volunteer opportunities for young people, ages 5-25, to serve locally, nationally, and globally.

organization.name: Foundation of the American Society of Association Executives
organization.missionStatement: The ASAE Foundation is the future-focused research arm for the association community. Through its programs, non-profit organizations have information and tools to anticipate changes that may impact them in the future, and have resources to help them be proactive in addressing those potential changes.
organization.description: The core purpose of the ASAE Foundation is to prepare the association community for a successful future. It accomplishes this through strategic research, tool development, and education around those topics.

organization.name: GRANTMAKERS FOR EFFECTIVE ORGANIZATIONS
organization.missionStatement: GEO's mission is to maximize philanthropy's impact by advancing the effectiveness of grantmakers and their grantees.
organization.description: Grantmakers for Effective Organizations is a community of grantmakers dedicated to building strong and effective organizations.

organization.name: BIPARTISAN POLICY CENTER INC
organization.missionStatement:
Too often partisanship poisons our national dialogue. Unfortunately, respectful discourse across party lines has become the exception - not the norm.
To confront this challenge, the Bipartisan Policy Center (BPC) was formed to develop and promote solutions that would attract the public support and political momentum to achieve real progress. The BPC acts as an incubator for policy efforts that engage top political figures, advocates, academics and business leaders in the art of principled compromise. In addition to advancing specific proposals, the BPC also is broadcasting a different type of policy discourse that seeks to unite the constructive center in the pursuit of common goals.
The Bipartisan Policy Center is a non-profit organization that was established in 2007 by former Senate Majority Leaders Howard Baker, Tom Daschle, Bob Dole and George Mitchell to provide a forum where tough policy challenges can be addressed in a pragmatic and politically viable manner. We seek to develop policy solutions that make sense for the nation and can be embraced by both parties. After reaching shared solutions through principled compromise, we will then work to implement these policies through the political system. The BPC is currently focused on five major issues: national security, health care, energy, agriculture, and transportation. Each of these efforts is led by a diverse team of political leaders, policy experts, business leaders and academics.

organization.name: International Board of Heart Rhythm Examiners, Inc
organization.missionStatement: INHRE is designed to elevate professional standards, enhance individual performance and demonstrate knowledge essential to the practice of heart rhythm management.
organization.description: IBHRE provides examinations in the fields of cardiac pacing and implantable cardioversion defibrillation.

organization.name: SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING ALLIANCE INC
organization.missionStatement: Enhance and strengthen the science and engineering research infrastructure among an alliance of historically black colleges and universities (HBCUs) to ensure production of globally competitive American scientists and engineers and meet public and private sector R&D needs.
organization.description: Science and Engineering Alliance (SEA) helps ensure production of globally competitive American scientists and engineers, while simultaneously meeting the R&D needs of the public and private sectors.

organization.name: District of Columbia Appleseed Center for Law and Justice, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: DC Appleseed works to make the National Capital Area a better place to live and work. Founded in 1994 by a group of concerned lawyers, DC Appleseed is a nonprofit organization dedicated to addressing important public policy questions facing the Washington DC metropolitan area. To advance this mission, DC Appleseed organizes volunteers, including attorneys and other experts, who work in teams to analyze and develop solutions to problems facing the region. Depending on the problem being addressed, DC Appleseed's projects involve working with broad coalitions, issuing reports, participating in regulatory proceedings, bringing lawsuits, managing public education campaigns, and meeting with and/or testifying before governmental decision-makers. DC Appleseed is an independent voice for reform. DC Appleseed project teams have four components. First, DC Appleseed enlists the aid of pro bono legal support from DC area law and accounting firms. This legal expertise is worth millions of dollars and is an invaluable resource in solving challenging problems. Second, this legal expertise is bolstered by the participation of pertinent consultants, some of them volunteer and some engaged through the support of foundations. Third, the project teams always involve the direct participation by members of DC Appleseed's distinguished board. And the final component of the project teams is DC Appleseed's staff, which includes three lawyers with diverse backgrounds in public interest advocacy, community development and education matters. The balance of our program staff has substantial experience in public policy analysis and non-profit management. Together, each team is comprised of experienced, dedicated professionals who are committed to solving the region's most pressing problems.
organization.description: DC Appleseed is an advocacy organization dedicated to making the National Capital Area a better place to live and work by analyzing serious local issues, developing recommendations for systemic reform, and advocating for appropriate solutions.

organization.name: HEART RHYTHM FOUNDATION INC
organization.missionStatement: To raise awareness about heart rhythm disorders, their diagnosis and treatment.
organization.description: The Foundation is the voice of support for patients with heart rhythm disorders, past, present, and future.

organization.name: NATIONAL BLACK CHILD DEVELOPMENT INSTITUTE INC
D C S C O R E S
organization.missionStatement: DC SCORES empowers students in urban communities using soccer, writing, creative expression, and service-learning. With teamwork as the unifying value, DC SCORES inspires youth to lead healthy lifestyles, be engaged students, and become agents of change in their communities.
organization.description: DC SCORES is Washington DC's leading after-school program working in partnership with the DC public schools to ensure that children are smart, healthy and creative.

organization.name: WASHINGTON METROPOLITAN SCHOLARS
organization.missionStatement: The rising cost of higher education provides an insurmountable barrier for some deserving students, and African Americans suffer disproportionately. Washington Metropolitan Scholars is a non-profit 501 (c) (3) organization that provides scholarship assistance to African American students from the Washington area, making it possible for high-achieving young men and women from families of modest income to attend some of the most acclaimed -- and most expensive -- colleges and universities in the nation.
organization.description: Washington Metropolitan Scholars provides college scholarships to outstanding African American students with financial need from the nation's capital and its surrounding suburbs.

organization.name: Mental Disability Rights International, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: MDRI documents conditions, publishes reports on human rights enforcement, and promotes international oversight of the rights of people with mental disabilities. Drawing on the skills and experience of attorneys, mental health professionals, human rights advocates, people with mental disabilities and their family members, MDRI is forging a new alliance to challenge the discrimination and abuse of people with mental disabilities throughout the world.
organization.description: International advocacy organization, that promotes the recognition and enforcement of the rights of people with mental disabilities, by documenting human rights abuses and training local advocates.

organization.name: Educational Fund to Stop Gun Violence
organization.missionStatement:
The Educational Fund to Stop Gun Violence's mission is to reduce gun violence by fostering effective community & national action. We are a progressive voice for strong gun laws.
We have a sustained history of collaboration and commitment to grassroots advocacy. Whether in support of national, state, or local policy change, firearm industry reform through civil litigation, youth development, or public education, the Educational Fund has collaborated successfully with activists nationwide.
organization.description: The Educational Fund to Stop Gun Violence was founded in 1978 as an educational nonprofit organization dedicated to stopping gun violence by fostering effective community and national action.

organization.name: SUICIDE PREVENTION ACTION NETWORK USA INC
organization.missionStatement: SPAN USA was formed by Jerry & Elsie Weyrauch, who lost their 34 year-old daughter, Terri, to suicide in 1988. Their goal was to create a way for survivors of suicide (i.e. those who have lost someone to suicide) to transform their grief into positive action in order to prevent future tragedies. The organization is comprised of volunteer community and quilt organizers who work locally to raise awareness and deliver messages about the importance of suicide prevention to community leaders and policy makers. SPAN USA's central office provides its network of organizers with relevant and important information regarding suicide prevention and mental illness. We maintain a website which provides information on legislation and other pertinent initiatives and provides numerous links to other resources on suicide and suicide prevention. We also have a Legislative Action Center, which allows our organizers as well as other visitors to our website to directly contact their Senators and Representatives, learn how they voted on certain bills, identify and contact local media outlets and read about important legislation.
organization.description: The Suicide Prevention Action Network (SPAN USA) is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to preventing suicide through public education and awareness, community action and federal, state and local grassroots advocacy.

organization.name: Council for Court Excellence
organization.missionStatement: Formed in Washington, D.C. in January 1982, the Council for Court Excellence is a nonprofit, nonpartisan, civic organization. The Council has been the moving force behind adoption of the one day/one trial jury system in the D.C. Superior Court, modernization of the trial and grand jury systems, reform of the District of Columbia probate laws and procedures, expansion of crime victim rights, improvement in court handling of child neglect and abuse cases, and proposing methods to speed resolution of civil cases by the D.C. trial and appellate courts. To improve the public's access to justice and increase their understanding of our justice system, the Council over the years has published and disseminated over 300,000 copies of plain-language booklets and other materials explaining a wide variety of court systems.
organization.description: The Council for Court Excellence is a nonprofit, nonpartisan civic organization founded in Washington, D.C. in 1982. The Council works to improve the administration of justice in the local and federal courts and related agencies in the Washington metropolitan area.

organization.name: FAIR CHANCE
organization.missionStatement: Fair Chance strengthens organizations that serve at-risk children and their families.&#160; By partnering with promising nonprofits to build their capacity, Fair Chance strives to ensure that underserved children have access to quality programs that will enable them to follow their dreams.
organization.description: Fair Chance builds the capacity of nonprofit organizations that improve the lives of children and youth living in Washington, DCs most underserved communities ? Wards 5, 6, 7 and 8.

organization.name: LUTHERAN VOLUNTEER CORPS
organization.missionStatement: Volunteers work for social justice as they staff shelters for homeless women, teach in inner-city after-school programs, advocate for the rights of marginalized people, work to protect the environment, assist families in obtaining affordable housing, and more. Positions vary from providing direct social services to working on root causes of social problems.
organization.description: LVC offers people a challenging year of exploring their spirituality while working for social justice, living in intentional community, and simplifying their lifestyles.

organization.name: INTERNATIONAL ECOTOURISM SOCIETY
organization.missionStatement:
TIES promotes responsible travel to natural areas that conserves the environment and improves the well-being of local people by:
- Creating an international network of individuals, institutions and the tourism industry - Educating tourists and tourism professionals - Influencing the tourism industry, public institutions and donors to integrate the principles of ecotourism into their operations and policies
organization.description: TIES is unique in its efforts to provide guidelines and standards, training, technical assistance, research, and publications to foster sound ecotourism development.

organization.name: Institute for International Mediation & Conflict Resolution
organization.missionStatement:
IIMCR, founded in 1995, grew out of a need to prepare future leaders in how to deal with conflicts in the world.<p>
IIMCR recognized that universities and governments around the globe are not providing their constituencies with the proper skills for preventing and dealing with conflict. As a result conflict, which can be abated through proactive problem solving, is instead triggering into increased tension and violence in all parts of the world.
organization.description: The Institute for International Mediation and Conflict Resolution (IIMCR), a non-profit educational institute based in Washington D.C, was established with the purpose of training and educating a select group of young men and women from around the world in the techniques of conflict management so they can use these tools to prevent and resolve conflict in their communities and workplaces.

organization.name: Voices for America's Children
organization.missionStatement: The mission of Voices for America's Children is to improve the lives of children in the United States by advocating for effective public policies. Adressing issues that impact child well-being from age zero to 21, VOICES ensures that the needs of children are raised in every policy debate. VOICES accomplishes its mission by advocating at the federal level and by strengthing member capacity to acieve their goals at the state and local level. Voices for America's Children is a national advocacy network that speaks up and gets results for kids.
organization.description: The mission of Voices for America's Children is to improve the lives of children in the United States by advocating for effective public policies. Addressing issues that impact child well-being from age zero to 21, VOICES ensures that the needs of children are raised in every policy debate. VOICES accomplishes its mission by advocating at the federal level and by strengthening member capacity to achieve their goals at the state and local level. Voices for America's Children is a national advocacy network that speaks up and gets results for kids.

organization.name: Rural Coalition
organization.missionStatement: The Rural Coalition was formed in 1978 to respond to the economic devastation occurring in rural communities due to the decline in small and family farms. In the early 1990's, collaborative policy work focused on the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) led small farmers to the conclusion that more was to be gained by working collaboratively than competing against each. The RC now includes nearly 100 member groups in the U.S. and Mexico working for a just and sustainable food system that brings fair returns to small farmers and rural communities, ensures just and fair working conditions for farm workers, protects the environment and ensures a safe and healthy food supply to consumers.
organization.description: The Rural Coalition is an alliance of organizations working to build a more just and sustainable food systems which brings fair returns to farmers & rural communities, just and fair working conditions for farm workers, protects the environment and bring safe and healthy food to consumers. Its programs include advocating for progressive national policies which support these efforts, as well as economic development efforts such as marketing products of small farms.

organization.name: Center for Religion and Diplomacy, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the International Center for Religion and Diplomacy (ICRD)is to address identity-based conflicts that exceed the reach of traditional diplomacy by incorporating religion as part of the solution.
organization.description: The mission of the International Center for Religion and Diplomacy (ICRD)is to address identity-based conflicts that exceed the reach of traditional diplomacy by incorporating religion as part of the solution.

organization.name: National Law Center on Homelessness and Poverty
organization.missionStatement: We work for positive, constructive solutions to help stabilize the lives of homeless people and provide them an opportunity to become productive citizens. Our work addresses the underlying causes of homelessness: the lack of housing, income, social services, and civil rights. We take a leadership role ensuring implementation of homeless assistance and rights programs while advancing solutions to homelessness, providing a voice to the over three million Americans who are homeless each year.
organization.description: We are a non-profit legal advocacy organization serving as the legal arm of the national movement to alleviate, prevent, and end homelessness.

organization.name: Association for Gerontology in Higher Education, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: AGHE is an organization composed of more than 300 institutional members--colleges, universities, private businesses, and government organizations that provide education, training, and research programs in gerontology and/or geriatrics. Through conferences, publications, technical assistance, research studies, and consultation with policy makers, AGHE, an educational unit of The Gerontological Society of America, seeks to advance gerontology as a field of study at institutions of higher education. As the only national membership organization devoted primarily to gerontological education, AGHE is in a unique position to develop and sponsor education and training initiatives and to involve students, educators, and businesspeople from across the country in providing resources for older adults and for those who serve them.
organization.description: AGHE is a national non-profit organization that fosters the development of, and increases the commitment of higher education to, the field of aging through education, research, and public service.

organization.name: Breakthrough Technologies Institute, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: BTI was formed in 1993 to promote the development and early commercialization of advanced environmental and energy technologies, including efficiency technologies, energy generation, storage and utilization technologies, and clean fuels. BTI communicates the benefits of selected advanced technologies to specialized audiences and the general public; supports the utilization of advanced technologies via demonstrations and early commercial purchases; stimulates communication and team-building in the private sector and between government, industry and community organizations; facilitates public understanding of the technologies through education; and fosters the appropriate legal and regulatory environment for advanced energy and environmental systems.
organization.description: BTI promotes environmentally advanced technologies through independent analysis, education, and information exchange worldwide, including the development and application of zero and near-zero emission pollution control technologies, nonpolluting and renewable fuels, and high efficiency, low emission energy generation, and utilization technologies.

organization.name: UNITED MINE WORKERS OF AMERICA INTL UNION HEALTH&WELFARE BENEFIT PL&TR
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
HORTICULTURAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE ENDOWMENT FUND INC
A C T AFFORDABLE HOUSING INC
ASSOCIATION OF OCC AND ENV CLINICS
BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU OF METROPOLITAN WASHINGTON INC
Homemaker Health Aide Service of the National Capital Area, Inc.
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC AFFAIRS & ADMINSTRATION
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MULTICULTURAL EDUCATION
organization.missionStatement: NAME was founded with the dual purpose of educational equity and social justice through education that is multicultural and all its aspects.
organization.description: The National Association for Multicultural Education is a nonprofit organization promoting multicultural edcuation from preschool through higher education.

organization.name: ILSI HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCES INSTITUTE
Suited for Change
organization.missionStatement:
Suited for Change provides professional clothing and ongoing career education to low-income women to increase their employment and job retention potential and to contribute to their economic independence.
Our services are available at no charge and by referral only to low-income women who have completed a job readiness program at any of the 150 job training and social service agencies with which we partner and are seeking employment.
Suited for Change serves about 110 women each month. Our clients come from DC (65%), MD (20%) and Northern VA (15%).
Since our founding in 1992, Suited for Change has helped more than 14,000 women in the transition from welfare to work.
organization.description: Suited for Change support low income women entering the job market by providing clothing, coaching, and confidence free of charge to low-income women in the Washington, DC metropolitan area.

organization.name: NATIONAL AIDS HOUSING COALITION INC
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to advance the development, management and growth of sound housing options for persons living with HIV/AIDS, and other vulnerable populations in our communities.
organization.description: The National AIDS Housing Coalition, a national public interest housing organization, utilizes its quantitative research, public policy and public health activities to educate legislators, policy makers, community leaders and consumers about the critical role housing plays in the continuum of care for persons living with HIV/AIDS in local communities. For the past fifteen years, NAHC has been the only national organization of HIV/AIDS agencies and health care providers focused on developing and implementing sound housing options that can support the housing and healthcare concerns of people living with or impacted by HIV/AIDS.

organization.name: SPW USA INC
organization.missionStatement: Students Partnership Worldwide (SPW) harnesses the energy and abilities of professionally-trained youth educators to implement peer-led educational programs, tackling social, health (specifically HIV/AIDS) and environmental issues facing young people in rural communities in Africa and Asia.
organization.description: Students Partnership Worldwide (SPW) is the global leader in engaging and supporting young people to address the urgent health, education and environmental issues which affect their lives, and the lives of their families, communities and countries.

organization.name: WASHINGTON INTERFAITH NETWORK
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1996, WIN is a multi-racial, multi-faith, strictly non-partisan, District-wide citizens' organization, rooted in local congregations and associations. WIN is committed to training and developing neighborhood leaders, to addressing community issues, and to holding elected officials accountable in Washington, DC. WIN's 48 dues-paying congregation, union, and school members represent 25,000 families in every section of the District and reflect its theological, racial, geographic, and economic diversity.
organization.description: To train community leaders in Washington, DC to make change on issues that affect their lives.

organization.name: DOWNTOWN CLUSTER OF CONGREGATIONS INC
organization.missionStatement: This agency maximizes cooperative efforts between congregations to improve the city and meet needs of the poor and disabled.
organization.description: An ecumenical association that meets pressing human service needs of the homeless, elderly and youth, as well as revitalizes neighborhoods and improves city services.

organization.name: US Chess Center Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The U.S. Chess Center teaches chess to children, especially those from disadvantaged neighborhoods, as a means of improving their academic and social skills.
organization.description: The U.S. Chess Center teaches chess to children, especially those from disadvantaged neighborhoods, as a means of improving their academic and social skills.

organization.name: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF WHOLESALERS DISTRIBUTORS INC
Association of State Service Commissions
organization.missionStatement:
ASC is a membership-based organization located in Washington, DC. We constantly seek to represent the needs of the field through advocacy, national representation and peer-to-peer support.
We are continually looking for ways to better serve our members and raise awareness for State Service Commissions in general on the national and local level. Below outlines the services we provide.
Services to our Network:
Facilitate peer-to-peer support opportunities for Commission members and staff
Provide materials, performance, and information
Annual national association meeting in partnership with the largest community service conference in the country
National, regional, and state events highlighting service and volunteerism Leadership development opportunities for Commission members and staff
Timely updates on legislative news
Assistance in the development of a unified voice, unique to State Service Commissions
Strategic partnerships with national nonprofit and philanthropic networks
Information and analysis on state policy initiatives that involve and channel resources through State Commissions
Networking opportunities
Regular information sharing with public, private, state, and federal policy makers Topical policy papers on issues related to service and volunteerism.
organization.description: Dedicated to advancing service and volunteerism in the United States, ASC works on behalf of a network of commission members and staff, who promote and represent all of the streams of national and community service.

organization.name: DOCS FOR TOTS
organization.missionStatement: The mission of Docs For Tots is to develop, support, and grow a nationwide network of doctors who respond to the requests of child advocacy organizations and others who request doctor participation in promoting policies and practices that improve the well-being of our youngest children. The network doctors carries out this mission by using the science fact-based resources of Docs For Tots and their own experience as doctors to highlight the unique needs of young children.
organization.description: Docs For Tots (DFT) is a nonprofit, nonpartisan, multi-faceted, advocacy organization, specifically focused on very young children and their families.

organization.name: Motorist Assurance Program, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Motorist Assurance Program (MAP) is dedicated to helping the automotive service and repair industry cultivate consumer trust. Both the shop and the consumer will get off to a better start, MAP believes, if they share a common "road map" to the customer's car, something each could follow to help prevent misunderstandings. MAP participants have such a road map: the uniform inspection & communication standards developed through MAP by the industry. The standards give the shop a customer relations/education tool to use before proceeding with any work. Service staff can review the standards with the consumer and give him or her a copy of the MAP required estimate, which explains in clear language what will be done to the vehicle and why.
organization.description: The Motorist Assurance Program (MAP) is a national non-profit to strengthen the relationship between consumers and the auto repair industry through education and the use of standards. Participating shops follow MAP Standards of Service and Uniform Inspection & Communication Standards, which provide a customer relations/education tool which inform customers what is REQUIRED and SUGGESTED to be repaired/replaced.

organization.name: Commission on Professionals in Science and Technology
organization.missionStatement: CPST is charged with collecting, analyzing and disseminating reliable information about the human resources of the United States in the fields of science and technology; promotion of the best possible programs of education and training for potential scientists, engineers, and technicians; and the development of policies for the utilization of scientific and technological human resources by educational institutions, industry and government for the optimum benefit to the nation.
organization.description: CPST, founded in 1953 as a participating organization of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, is a nonprofit corporation whose membership includes leading professional societies, corporations, institutions, and individuals concerned with advancing the public's understanding of professionals in science and technology, their roles, education, and employment.

organization.name: National Tree Trust
organization.missionStatement: The National Tree Trust promotes healthy communities by providing resources that educate and empower people to grow and care for urban and community forests.
organization.description: The National Tree Trust was founded in 1990 by America the Beautiful to act as a catalyst for local volunteer groups in the growing, planting and maintenance of trees in rural communities, urban areas, and along the nation's highways.

organization.name: National Congress for Community Economic Development, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: NCCED provides information on available public and private sector resources to its members. NCCED serves as a national network for CDCs, allowing to keep in contact with each other. It also advocates for more resources from federal, state, corporate, and philanthropic sources for CDCs.
organization.description: NCCED is the national trade association for community-based development corporations (CDCs). These member groups provide housing and jobs in low-income communities across the U.S.

organization.name: Global Education Partnership, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
G.E.P. is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization with headquarters in Washington D.C. and divisions in the San Francisco Bay Area, Guatemala, Kenya, Indonesia, and Tanzania. G.E.P.'s mission is to provide access to educational resources that increase the capacity of young people to become employable and self-reliant in the global marketplace. G.E.P. offers entrepreneurship and employment training for low-income youth, organizes community-based school-development projects, and coordinates workshops which focus on innovative teaching techniques and strategic planning at the local level. G.E.P. believes that the youth it serves are not simply passive recipients of aid, but are catalysts of their own economic and social development. Educational Resource Development Projects (ERDPs) initiated overseas are based on a "matching-funds" philosophy. Local communities raise 50% of the funding for each project, then G.E.P. matches those funds and provides communities with our in-country staff's support and expertise during and after project implementation. Using this method, G.E.P. has improved the educational outlook for over 800,000 children in Africa, Latin America, and Asia.
G.E.P.'s Entrepreneurship and Employment Training Programs (EETPs) and Teacher Training Workshops are aimed at providing youth between the ages of 15 and 24 not only with access to information technology skills, but also with the business and entrepreneurial skills they need to market these skills successfully. G.E.P. provides direct services to over 375 youth and 100 educators worldwide per year. This includes training in entrepreneurship, work-readiness, computer, and global awareness skills. G.E.P. also maintains a venture capital fund to help young entrepreneurs start their own businesses.
G.E.P. was founded in July 1994 by Tony Silard. While at Harvard completing a Master's in Public Policy, Silard worked as Employment and Training Coordinator at Roxbury Youthworks (an inner-city, community-based youth agency) teaching work readiness and entrepreneurship skills. Recognition for Silard's work includes the Robert F. Kennedy Public Service Award, the Echoing Green Public Service Award and the Manuel Carballo Award.
organization.description: G.E.P.'s mission is to provide access to educational resources that increase the capacity of young people to become employable and self-reliant in the global marketplace. G.E.P. is based in Washington, D.C. and has divisions in California, Guatemala, Kenya, Indonesia, and Tanzania.

organization.name: Parents & Friends of Lesbian & Gay Men of Washington Metro Area, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Metropolitan Washington Chapter for Parents, Families, and Friends of Lesbians and Gays is to promote the health and well-being of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender persons, their families, and friends through support to cope with an adverse society, education to enlighten an ill-informed public, and advocacy to end discrimination and to secure equal civil rights. PFLAG provides opportunity for dialogue about sexual orientation and acts to create a society that is healthy and respectful of human diversity.
organization.description: PFLAG of Metro DC promotes the health and well-being of gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender persons, their families, and friends through support, education, and advocacy.

organization.name: FACES AND VOICES OF RECOVERY
organization.missionStatement: For too long a great majority of the recovery community has been silent about their experiences and successes. As a result, there has been no unified public voice advocating on behalf of recovery and for those who still need to achieve it. We are organizing and rallying individuals and recovery community organizations in a campaign to end discrimination; broaden social understanding and achieve a just response to addiction as a public health crisis. We are mobilizing to advocate for recovery and help more Americans overcome addiction to alcohol and other drugs.
organization.description: Faces & Voices of Recovery is a national campaign of people in recovery from addiction, their family members, friends and allies. We are organizing and rallying individuals and recovery community organizations in a campaign to end discrimination; broaden social understanding and achieve a just response to addiction as a public health crisis.

organization.name: Kids Enjoy Exercise Now
organization.missionStatement: KEEN's mission is to foster the self-esteem, confidence, skills and talents of its athletes through non-competitive activities, allowing young people facing even the most significant challenges to meet their individual goals.
organization.description: KEEN is a national volunteer-driven nonprofit organization that provides free one-to-one recreational opportunities for children and young adults with mental and physical disabilities.

organization.name: American Sleep Apnea Association, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The ASAA was founded in 1990 by concerned persons with apnea and health care providers and researchers. Patients were frustrated that there was no organization to which they could turn for information and help while doctors, aware of the importance of such organizations, were frustrated that there was no place to which they could refer their patients. Since its inception, the all-volunteer board has been comprised of persons affected by sleep apnea as well as leaders in the field of sleep medicine. Together they have worked to fulfill the ASAA's mission of educating the public and health care professionals about sleep apnea and serving as an advocate for people with this common disorder.
