organization.description: The ASAA educates the public and health care professionals about this disorder; sponsors support groups; and serves as an advocate for people with sleep apnea.

organization.name: CLEAN BEACHES COUNCIL
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Clean Beaches Council is to preserve America's coastal heritage through public awareness and voluntary participation in programs that will ensure a legacy of sustainable beaches for generations to come.
organization.description: Clean Beaches Council is a national organization devoted to protecting and preserving America's beaches.

organization.name: Campus Outreach Opportunity League, Inc
organization.missionStatement: Created in 1984 to combat the stereotype that college students are apathetic, COOL's mission is to educate and empower college students to strengthen our nation through community service. Our vision is to educate, mobilize, and connect students of all backgrounds to lead a movement that increases participation in our communities, promotes activism, and fosters the civic and social responsibility necessary to build a just society.
organization.description: COOL empowers and trains college students across the country to develop and improve community service and service-learning programs on their own campuses.

organization.name: National Fuel Funds Network
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the National Fuel Funds Network is to increase financial resources for people with low income to pay for home energy costs. NFFN supports and promotes charitable energy programs or fuel funds and advocates for increased federal energy assistance.
organization.description: National Fuel Funds Network consists of 290 nonprofit and utility members who raise $100 million annually to disadvantaged customers needing financial assistance with utility bills. The National Fuel Funds Network's Katrina Assistance Fund provides financial assistance to pay home heating and cooling bills.

organization.name: ATLANTIC COUNCIL OF THE U S
Moroccan-American Cultural Center Inc
organization.missionStatement: Encourages cultural and educational programs that broaden awareness and understanding of Morocco among key American constituencies including schools, public affairs organizations, religiously-affiliated groups, cultural institutions, and NGOs.
organization.description: Promotes greater understanding of Morocco through educational and cultural programming and a grants program that supports organizations and individuals that share our objectives.

organization.name: National Funding Collaborative on Violence Prevention, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The National Funding Collaborative on Violence Prevention was established by grantmakers in 1994 to focus national and local attention on the primary prevention of violence. We believe that violence prevention strategies are most effective when it is the people most affected by violence who decide what to implement and how. In eight communities across the US, we have developed partnerships with local collaborative who use community empowerment and citizen engagement as the basis for building and sustaining violence-free communities.
organization.description: NFCVP is a public/private partnership that promotes the development of safe, healthy and peaceful homes and communities. We support strategies that emphasize citizen and resident engagement and community empowerment and comprehensively address the range of factors that undermine safety.

Chiefs of Police National Drug Task Force

Today, our members over 80,000 computing professionals and students world-wide and the public turn to ACM for authoritative publications, pioneering conferences, and visionary leadership for the new millennium.
organization.description: ACM is committed to bringing potentially significant technical and public policy issues to the attention of the ACM membership and the community.

BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA TRUST FUND
organization.missionStatement: The Mission of the Boy Scouts of America is to prepare young people to make ethical choices over their lifetime by instilling in them the values of the Scout Oath and Law. To support Boy Scouts of America, visit www.give2bsa.org.
organization.description: The Boy Scouts of America is the nation's foremost youth program of character development and values-based leadership training. To support Boy Scouts of America, visit www.give2bsa.org.

organization.name: METROPOLITAN WASH DC SYNOD OF THE EVANG LUTH CHURCH IN AMERICA
organization.missionStatement: The Metropolitian Washington DC Synod sponsors a fundraising effort called the United Lutheran Appeal (ULA). The ULA receives funds for 13 Lutheran affiliated social service and educational institutions in the Metro DC area.
organization.description: The Metropolitian Washington DC Synod is a organization of 75 Lutheran Churches, in Northern VA, DC, and Maryland, that belong to the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA).

organization.name: HEADSTART TO LIFE INC
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to provide employment services to the young adults of the Washington, D.C. Metropolitan area, who are underprivileged and/or disabled. These services will include job development, job coaching support and work skills classes. We will strive to be the leader in an innovative approach to secure and maintain long-term career-oriented employment.
organization.description: Our purpose is to provide services to underprivileged and/or disabled young adults in the Washington D.C Metropolitan area guiding them to independence.

organization.name: National Center For Transgender Equality
organization.missionStatement:
The National Center for Transgender Equality is a national social justice organization devoted to ending discrimination and violence against transgender people through education and advocacy on national issues of importance to transgender people.
By empowering transgender people and our allies to educate and influence policymakers and others, NCTE facilitates a strong and clear voice for transgender equality in our nation's capital and around the country.
organization.description: As the only professionally-staffed, transgender-specific organization in the country working on federal policy and issues of national significance to transgender communities, NCTE fills a critical niche in the overall movement for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender civil rights.

organization.name: New York Avenue Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The mission of NYAF is to assist young people to complete schooling in the District of Columbia public and charter schools and to go on to additional education.
organization.description: The NYAF is dedicated to improving educational opportunities for inner-city residents of Washington, D.C.

organization.name: Children's Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the Children's Foundation is to provide a voice for children and their families on issues of critical concern. Two national programs allow the Foundation to work with low-income families and the working poor on child care, child nutrition, and the enforcement of court-ordered child support. The Foundation helps families help themselves through advocacy and training.
organization.description: The mission of the Children's Foundation is to provide a voice for children and their families on issues of critical concern. Two national programs allow the Foundation to work with low-income families and the working poor on child care, child nutrition

organization.name: SELF HELP FOUNDATION INC
organization.missionStatement: The Self Help Foundation, founded in 2001, grew out of the need to equip individuals and families in need and from financially handicapped backgrounds to help them to be self supporting through training and skills development facilities for unemployed and unskilled persons, including recipients of public welfare benefits that would enable the beneficiaries to earn their living. Additionally the Foundation aims to provide home ownership counselling as well as a broad range of intervention programs and preventive care initiatives that help adults, youth, and families develop and maintain healthy lives.
organization.description: The Self Help Foundation is an organization that facilitates programs to relieve poverty, advance education, and promote and protect good health in disadvantaged and under-served communities.

organization.name: AFRICAN AMERICAN COALITION AGAINST HIV & AIDS
organization.missionStatement: AACAA focuses on promoting prevention, education and testing among communities of color in areas that have been highly impacted by HIV/AIDS.
organization.description: AACAA is committed to promoting the importance of HIV/AIDS prevention, education and testing among African Americans and other communities of color in and around the DC, Baltimore and NY metropolitan areas.

organization.name: NATIONAL LESBIAN AND GAY LAW ASSOCIATION
organization.missionStatement: NLGLA provides professional networking and education, and career advancement opportunities to its own members, and to its 27 affiliate LGBT bar associations.
organization.description: The National Lesbian and Gay Law Association, and its sister Foundation, exist to promote justice in and through the legal profession for the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community in all its diversity.

organization.name: AMERICA RECYCLES DAY INC
organization.missionStatement: To hold an annual national awareness event to promote the social, environmental and economic benefits of buying recycled products and recycling.
organization.description: The goal of America Recycles Day is to increase the purchase of recycled content products and recycing throughout the United States and its territories.

organization.name: Center for Excellence In Assisted Living
organization.missionStatement: The mission of the CEAL is to foster access to high quality assisted living.
organization.description: The mission of the CEAL is to foster access to high quality assisted living.

organization.name: PEACE CORPS ENCORE INC
organization.missionStatement: We address the major social challenges of our time by deploying the skills, experience and commitment of former Peace Corps volunteers and staff members to meet them.
organization.description: Peace Corps Encore! provides volunteer expert consultants to build the capacity of our partners in the developing world to meet their development priorities and promote sustainable livelihoods for their communities.

organization.name: RAINBOW HISTORY PROJECT
organization.missionStatement: Our mission is to collect, preserve, and promote an active knowledge of the history, arts, and culture relevant to sexually diverse communities in metropolitan Washington DC.
organization.description: The Rainbow History Project mission is to preserve our community's history by providing educational, cultural, and archival sources of information on gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgendered history in metropolitan Washington DC.

organization.name: The Edmund Burke Institute For American Renewal Inc
organization.missionStatement: The Edmund Burke Institute For American Renewal seeks to integrate African Americans, Hispanics, women and other minorities into the conservative movement. We seek to educate leaders about the needs of minorities and also to demonstrate to minorities how their issues can best be addressed within the conservative movement. We want to redefine the conservative movement for the 21st century.
organization.description: The Edmund Burke Institute For American Renewal is a non-profit, non-partisan education and outreach organization that seeks to integrate women and minorities into the conservative movement.

organization.name: COMMITTEE OF CHIEF RISK OFFICERS INC
CONSTITUTION PROJECT
organization.missionStatement: The Constitution Project seeks consensus solutions to complex legal and constitutional issues. It does this through constructive dialogue across ideological and partisan lines, and through scholarship, activism, and public education efforts.
organization.description: The Constitution Project is an independent think tank that safeguards the Constitution. We do so through strategic communications and public education programs.

organization.name: African American Nonprofit Network
organization.missionStatement:
The African American Nonprofit Network was founded in 2006 to strengthen diversity among the leadership of nonprofit organizations within the National Capital Region. By broadening the base of African American management and leadership, AANN helps nonprofits better understand and address the needs of the children, youth and families they serve.
AANN achieves these results by helping nonprofit organizations in the National Capital Region identify:
* Experienced African American managers within the nonprofit sector to serve as president, executive director, CEO, COO, CFO, chief human services officer, and in other senior management capacities; * Talented African Americas in other arenas, such as the for-profit sector and military service, that are interested in working in the nonprofit sector, and helping them to transition their careers; and * African Americans with strong leadership skills that are interested in serving as board members, advisors, and mentors for board members.
AANN was created by 11 community leaders who were concerned about the heavy turnover and lack of diversity among leadership in the nonprofit sector. These visionary leaders shared a history of working and volunteering in the nonprofit sector. They understood the challenges nonprofits face, listened to various viewpoints, and united to strengthen the nonprofit community in the National Capital Region.
AANN received seed support and strategic assistance from the Venture Philanthropy Partners (VPP), a philanthropic investment organization that concentrates investments of money, expertise and personal contacts to improve the lives and boost the opportunities of children and youth of low-income families in the National Capital Region.
organization.description: he mission of the African American Nonprofit Network (AANN) is to significantly change the landscape of African American leadership in the National Capital Region so that nonprofit organizations can better empower the constituents they serve and have a positive impact on the community.

organization.name: CITY PARKS ALLIANCE INC
organization.missionStatement:
CPA seeks:
-greater involvement and investment in our nation's city parks -greater recognition of the role city parks play in building stronger, heathier, and more livable cities -a stronger and broader nationwide constituency of supporters to place city parks higher on the list of the nation's priorities.
organization.description: City Parks Alliance is a national organization comprised of city parks and recreation leaders from across the country who work together to strengthen America's city parks.

organization.name: Washington Academy of Sciences
organization.missionStatement: As a confederation of over 60 Scientific Societies and over 400 individual members, we facilitate cross-fertilization among the multifarious scientific disciplines
organization.description: To encourage the advancement of science and to conduct, endow, or assist investigation in any department of science in the Washington DC area

organization.name: REACH FOR COLLEGE INC
organization.missionStatement: From the D.C. schools fewer than 30% of students go to college and only 9% graduate from college.&#160; This leaves a vast majority of students unprepared for life in which 70% of jobs now require some form of postsecondary education.&#160; Reach for College! believes all students should aim for some form of education beyond high school to have the best shot at life.&#160; We believe all students can be successful with enough determination.&#160; We believe it&#8217;s important to help low-income students because our society needs them to be educated, contributing members of their communities.&#160; We all need their vibrancy, their caring hearts, and their good ideas.&#160; Reach for College! was founded in 2005 by two urban educators who saw the need and created a highly successful means to help traditionally disadvantaged students over the obstacles to college.
organization.description: Reach for College! provides curricular books and a program to schools and community groups to help low-income students get over the hurdles to postsecondary education.

organization.name: JEWS UNITED FOR JUSTICE INC
organization.missionStatement: In the Spring of 1998, inspired by a class on the social justice teachings of Rabbi Abraham Joshua Heschel, a small group of long-time Jewish activists and younger union and community organizers founded Jews United for Justice (JUFJ). JUFJ seeks to organize a visible Jewish presence and take action for economic and social justice in the Washington, DC area. JUFJ provides Jews with an opportunity to weave together Judaism and activism and creates a community in which they can explore and strengthen their commitments to both. JUFJ became an independent tax-exempt nonprofit in October, 2001.
organization.description: Jews United for Justice (JUFJ) is a Washington, DC-based nonprofit that organizes a visible Jewish presence in local social and economic justice struggles.

organization.name: National Association of State Departments of Agriculture
organization.missionStatement:
The NASDA Research Foundation (Foundation) was established and incorporated in Washington, DC, in 1981 to provide agriculturally oriented research, education, and training.
The Foundation, which had been dormant for several years, was revived in 1994 to work in cooperation with the Alternative Agricultural Research and Commercialization Center (AARC) at the U.S. Department of Agriculture to promote new high-value industrial uses for U.S. agricultural products ($110,000 grant total). With the success of this initial project, it was determined that the Foundation should expand in scope.
In 1995-97, the Foundation worked with the Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) to develop resource management planning tools for farmers, ranchers and agricultural organizations ($139,000 grant total). As part of this agreement, NRCS has established a full time NRCS consultant position in NASDA's headquarters' office to further the objectives of this program.
In 1996, as a logical extension of the NRCS program, the Foundation obtained a grant funded by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), to produce state-by-state guides of environmental laws and regulations ($92,800 total, $46,585 remaining, $9,375 outstanding - grant runs through September 2000). In 1998-99 the Foundation made excellent progress in this ongoing project. As of September 1999, eight completed guides are available on NASDA's website and have been printed, 19 draft guides have recently been reviewed by state agencies (the step preceding completion), and several others are in the draft stage.
Also in 1999, the Foundation completed a $50,000, yearlong project with the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to research laws and regulations affecting food safety nationwide. The Foundation received all $50,000 from FDA during FY1999, of which $45,000 was paid to the University of Arkansas's National Center for Agricultural Law Research and Information for production of the food regulation guide.
The Foundation currently has no staff of its own, but uses NASDA staff as appropriate under an agreement with NASDA.
organization.description: NASDA Research Foundation is a subsidiary of the National Association of State Departments of Agriculture, which focuses on research, education and promotion of issues affecting the farmers and ranchers of the fifty states and four territories.

organization.name: INSTITUTE FOR WAR & PEACE REPORTING US
COUNCIL FOR EMERGING NATIONAL SECURITY AFFAIRS
organization.missionStatement: CENSA's mission is to contribute to the ongoing dialogue shaping national security policy through formal discussion series, graduate level teaching programs, and collaborative research projects leading to publications of lasting quality. CENSA's activities draw upon the talents of its membership, a diverse, midcareer group of public sector foreign policy specialists, military officers, private sector professionals, and accomplished academics.
organization.description: The Council for Emerging National Security Affairs (CENSA) is a nonpartisan, nonprofit research organization established in 1999.

organization.name: BROTHER HELP THYSELF INC
organization.missionStatement: We fund, We mentor, We augment, we facilitate cooperation between our communities organizations for 28 years.
organization.description: We nurture and support nonprofit organizations in the GLBTQ and HIV/AIDS service communities of Metro Baltimore and Washington, DC.

organization.name: THOMAS CIRCLE SINGERS
organization.missionStatement: TCS enhances the quality of life in the city by bringing superb musical performances to diverse audiences and by providing financial support for nonprofits that assist city residents in need.
organization.description: A chamber choral ensemble that performs a diverse classical repertoire and donates all proceeds from its regular concert season to social service organizations in Washington.

organization.name: Global Action for Children
organization.missionStatement: Global Action for Children is the only US based coalition solely dedicated to advocating on behalf of orphans and highly vulnerable children in the developing world. Our mission is to ensure these children have access to health care, food, education and social protection.
organization.description: Global Action for Children is a non-partisan results-oriented coalition dedicated to improving the lives of orphans and highly vulnerable children in developing countries by increasing and improving effective use of funding.

organization.name: Mentors, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The mission of Mentors, Inc. is to increase the graduation rates and success of students enrolled in the District of Columbia?s public high schools by pairing them with caring adult volunteers in structured and enriched mentoring relationships that promote their personal, academic and career development.
organization.description: Mentors Inc. students attending Washington, DC public high school with successful professionals who serve as role models, guides and advisors, ensuring that students stay in school and graduate with a plan for transitioning into postsecondary education or meaningful employment.

organization.name: National Neighborhood Coalition
organization.missionStatement:
The mission of the National Neighborhood Coalition (NNC) is to promote socially and economically healthy and vibrant neighborhoods. We serve as the "national voice for neighborhoods" in Washington, D.C. and promote a neighborhood focus at all levels of government. NNC advocates for policies and programs that foster effective partnership between neighborhood groups, private sector institutions, and government agencies.
NNC members share a commitment to the revitalization of low and moderate-income neighborhoods and the solving of community problems. We believe that by making neighborhoods work for residents, we make our communities healthy and sustainable places for all to live.
organization.description: NNC promotes policies that strengthen the role of community and neighborhood-based nonprofits as problem solvers and fosters communications among organizations working to build sustainable communities.

organization.name: The Institute on Religion and Public Policy
organization.missionStatement: Within the vast expanse of human understanding and experience, every element of a human being s life anywhere in the world is, in one way or another, affected by religion and public policy. As religion scholar Dr. Martin E. Marty has commented, religion and politics inevitably intersect . Politics, by dealing with proposals for the common good, inevitably touches on people s basic ideas about what is most important in life. For most Americans, this means drawing religious understandings of reality and human purpose. From Christian to Muslim to Jew to atheist, and every faith in between, we are all influenced by a personal acceptance or rejection of religious principles, and by the decisions, dictates, and functioning of government. Instead of competition, conflict, and ill will, which often develop, these most two fundamental elements in the daily lives of human beings should be in cooperation and dialogue. The Institute on Religion and Public Policy is building bridges between religion and policy to advance a more constructive, peaceful future.
organization.description: The Institute on Religion and Public Policy seeks to shape the public participation in policy of the American community of faith. The Institute facilitates the expression of faith in the public interest through program activities and research in the public policymaking process. The Institute promotes cooperation and communication between policymakers and faith-based organizations and charities to achieve an optimal relationship on domestic and international public policy concerns. The Institute on Religion and Public Policy impacts and affects those places where religion seems to have an identifiable and inextricable influence on public life.

organization.name: ADVOCACY PROJECT
organization.missionStatement: The Advocacy Project supports advocates who work for social justice and human rights at the community level. AP does this by helping them in the way they use information.
organization.description: Human Rights and social justice advocacy

organization.name: Trust for the National Mall
organization.missionStatement: The Trust for the National Mall will help restore, revitalize and preserve the National Mall, home to the enduring symbols of our democracy, for present and future generations. We will succeed in this mission by focusing on the following: supporting the National Park Service as it undertakes the National Mall Plan; raising the necessary funds to maintain and restore the National Mall as a world-class park; connecting visitors with the National Mall?s rich history; developing engaging programs and events that will educate and inspire current and future generations; and funding an endowment to insure the future maintenance and upkeep of the park.
organization.description: The Trust for the National Mall is the Official Partner of the National Park Service charged with raising funds to restore and preserve the National Mall and to enhance visitors' experience through engaging educational programs and events.

organization.name: WASHINGTON INNER CITY LACROSSE FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: The Washington Inner City Lacrosse Foundation (WINNERS Lacrosse) is a non-profit organization that spreads the history, values and skills of the sport of lacrosse to greater Washington metropolitan area youth. The organization seeks to foster important lifetime virtues and character assets that contribute to the positive development of youth including sportsmanship, teamwork, and academic, social and personal achievement.
organization.description: WINNERS Lacrosse is a non-profit organization that teaches the history and skills of lacrosse and important character values to youth from historically underserved neighborhoods in the Washington metropolitan area.

organization.name: NATIONAL LESBIAN AND GAY LAW FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: The Foundation and its sister organization, the National Lesbian and Gay Law Association, exists to promote justice in and through the legal profession for the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community in all its diversity.
organization.description: National professional association of lawyers, judges, and other legal professionals, including law students and affiliated LGBT legal organizations.

organization.name: EDUIT INC
organization.missionStatement: To level global "education using information technology" (EDUIT) with emphasis on Math and Science.
organization.description: Eduit will helps to unite students around the world with the best educators and educational material and the best technology; to create an immersive modular web 2.0+ platform that can: 1. Compliment the educational needs of students and parents by creating fun, easy to use online education system. 2. Compliment the educational needs of communities by helping to educate it's stakeholders in math and science. 3. Compliment the educational needs of societies by helping to build a highly educated and trained workforce. 4. empower the effectiveness of educators by making education fun and easy for all regardless of thier social and economic disposition.

organization.name: Street Sense, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Street Sense serve as a vehicle for elevating voices and public debate on issues relating to poverty while also creating economic opportunities for people in the community who are experiencing homelessness.

organization.name: US Foundation for the University of Victoria
organization.missionStatement:
US Foundation for the University of Victoria, founded in 1997, was formed to assist the University of Victoria in establishing liaisons in the United States to make its cultural and educational programs more readily available and accessible to the American public.
The Foundation encourages the participation of American students in the educational programs of the University of Victoria by providing scholarships for American students for undergraduate and graduate study at the University.
organization.description: US Foundation for the University of Victoria promotes, encourages and fosters an appreciation by the American public of the work being conducted by the University of Victoria in the various educational disciplines deemed to be of interest to the American public.

organization.name: SIKH MEDIA ACTION RESOURCE TASK FORCE
organization.missionStatement: Founded as the Sikh Mediawatch and Resource Task Force (SMART) in 1996, SALDEF is a national non-profit civil rights and educational organization. We empower Sikh Americans through legal assistance, educational outreach, legislative advocacy and media relations.
organization.description: Founded as the Sikh Mediawatch and Resource Task Force (SMART) in 1996, SALDEF began solely as an all-volunteer organization with a primary focus on media analysis and education. Based on the needs of the Sikh American community, SALDEF immediately began responding to civil rights, legislative, employment discrimination, and public accommodation issues. Currently, SALDEF maintains a full-time staff in addition to several volunteer local representatives and regional directors. Its pro bono legal team includes several part-time volunteer attorneys who handle legal matters affecting Sikh Americans.

organization.name: Silent Auctioneer.ORG, Inc.
organization.description: TSA is a US nonprofit that helps other nonprofits raise money using the Internet. Our goal is to help bridge the Digital Divide for families through Internet Seminars and workshops.

organization.name: Research Institute for Small & Emerging Business, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: RISEbusiness, founded in 1996, grew out of the need for high-quality information based on rigorous qualitative and quantitative research on the small and emerging business sector. By providing corporations, policymakers, business or trade associations serving this sector with substantive and insightful research on issues impacting the formation and growth of small and emerging businesses, we inform and enhance decisionmaking pertaining to this important sector of the economy.
organization.description: RISEbusiness enhances the formation and growth of small and emerging businesses by developing and disseminating high-quality, groundbreaking research on issues affecting this sector.

organization.name: U S PUBLIC SERVICE ACADEMY
organization.missionStatement: The Academy will reinvigorate our sense of public service, revitalize our public sector, and strengthen our civilian leadership. Our mission is to educate and develop civilian leaders who have the character, intellect, and experience necessary to serve the nation honorably and effectively, and who are committed to devoting their lives to public service.
organization.description: The U.S. Public Service Academy seeks to build a civilian counterpart to the military service academies: a four-year, federally-subsidized college focused on developing civilian leaders.

The GAVI Fund
organization.missionStatement:
The GAVI Fund's mission is to act as a catalyst harnessing resources so that all the world's children have equal access to lifesaving vaccines. A child in a developing country is 10 times more likely to die of a vaccine-preventable disease than a child in the industrialized world. The GAVI Fund focuses its energies on bringing vaccines and resources to the world's poorest countries to end this needless loss of life.
Partnering with the Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunization (GAVI), The Vaccine Fund will provide lifesaving vaccines to millions of children around the world, while creating a model for fiscal accountability and collaboration.
The Vaccine Fund's mission is simple: to ensure that every child, everywhere has equal access to life-saving vaccines.
organization.description: The GAVI Fund works to protect children in the world's poorest countries from vaccine-preventable diseases.

organization.name: MORRIS AND GWENDOLYN CAFRITZ FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: The Morris & Gwendolyn Cafritz Foundation is committed to building a stronger community for residents of the Washington, DC area through support of programs in arts and humanities, community services, education, and healthcare.
organization.description: The Foundation is committed to improving the quality of life for residents of the Washington, DC area.

organization.name: PARALYZED VETERANS OF AMERICA
organization.missionStatement:
Paralyzed Veterans of America (PVA), a congressionally chartered veterans service organization founded in 1946, has developed a unique expertise on a wide variety of issues involving the special needs of our members? veterans of the armed forces who have experienced spinal cord injury or dysfunction.
PVA will use that expertise to be the leading advocate for: - Quality health care for our members, - Research and education addressing spinal cord injury and dysfunction, - Benefits available as a result of our members? military service, - Civil rights and opportunities which maximize the independence of our members and all people with disabilities.
For more than 60 years, PVA has fought for our veterans who answered the call when our nation asked for their service . . . and in return, they have given up their freedoms to protect ours.
For more information visit www.SupportVeterans.org or www.pva.org.
organization.description: PVA assists paralzyed veterans with spinal cord injury through veteran benefits services, advocacy, pro bono legal help, disability rights, sports & Hurricane Katrina disaster relief.

organization.name: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution
organization.missionStatement: The objectives of the National Society Daughters of the American Revolution are promoting historic preservation, education and patriotism. We accomplish our mission through over 2,500 chapters in the US and nine foreign countries. Our Americana Collection houses over 5,000 documents focusing on early America; The DAR Library includes 160,000 volumes of genealogical information; The DAR Museum is free and open to the public and is home to a collection of over 30,000 objects and 29 Period Rooms prior to 1840.
organization.description: NSDAR was established to perpetuate the memory and spirit of the men and women who achieved American independence. The mission of the DAR is to promote historic preservation, education, and patriotism.

organization.name: Pact, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Pact's mission is to help build strong communities globally that provide people with an opportunity to earn a dignified living, raise healthy families, and participate in democratic life. Pact accomplishes this by strengthening the capacity of grassroots organizations, coalitions and networks and by forging linkages among government, business and the citizen sector to achieve social, economic and environmental justice.
organization.description: Pact's mission is to help build strong communities globally that provide people with an opportunity to earn a dignified living, raise healthy families, and participate in democratic life. Pact accomplishes this by strengthening the capacity of grassroots organizations, coalitions and networks and by forging linkages among government, business and the citizen sector to achieve social, economic and environmental justice.

organization.name: UNITED FOOD AND COMMERCIAL WORKERS INTERNATIONAL UNION
AMERICAN FEDERATION OF LABOR & CONGRESS OF INDUSTRIAL ORGS
NCB DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION
organization.description: NCBDC is a non-profit [501 (c)(3)] organization whose mission is "to provide solutions based on cooperative principles that empower underserved communities to address the problems poverty creates in America."

organization.name: B'NAI B'RITH INTERNATIONAL
organization.missionStatement: B&#8217;nai B&#8217;rith is an international Jewish organization committed to the security and continutity of the Jewish people, defending human rights, combating anti-Semitism, bigotry and ignorance, and providing service to the community on the broadest principles of humanity.
organization.description: With members in over 50 countries, B'nai B'rith's mission is to unite persons of the Jewish faith and to enhance Jewish identity through strengthening Jewish family life, the education and training of youth, broadbased services for the benefit of senior citizens, and advocacy on behalf of Jews around the world.

organization.name: DKT INTERNATIONAL INC
organization.missionStatement: DKT International provides couples with affordable and safe options for family planning and HIV/AIDS prevention through dynamic social marketing programs.
organization.description: DKT International is a charitable organization that implements family planning and HIV/AIDs prevention social marketing programs in 12 countries.

organization.name: Patient Access Network Foundation
organization.missionStatement:
Provide financial assistance for medications in 20 disease-state funds for cancers and and chronic diseases.
- Have provided co-pay assistance to almost 50,000 patients.
organization.description: Dedicated to improving access for insured patients who cannot afford the out-of-pocket costs of life-saving medications.

organization.name: United Way of the National Capital Area
organization.missionStatement: The mission of United Way of the National Capital Area (UWNCA) is to serve the needs of the community and act as a community problem-solving mechanism by raising the maximum amount of contributions from individuals, corporations, and other public and private organizations in the region. UWNCA does this through a single, efficient, annual campaign on behalf of almost 900 UWNCA member agencies providing services in the Washington metro area. Donors may designate to particular nonprofit organizations or to the United Way Community Impact Funds, which focus on the most critical needs in the region.
organization.description: Founded in 1974, UWNCA is the largest non-governmental health and human services fund provider in the Washington metro area. Working with community organizations, local governments and businesses, UWNCA's eight regional councils -- located in DC, Northern VA and Southwest MD -- respond to critical community needs.

organization.name: INTERNATIONAL UNION OF PAINTERS AND ALLIED TRADES
Corcoran Gallery of Art
organization.missionStatement: Founded in 1869 by financier and philanthropist William Wilson Corcoran, the Corcoran Gallery of Art is one of the oldest private art museums in the nation and home to the only college of art and design in the nation's capital. The Museum possesses an impressive collection of 18th-, 19th-, and 20th-century American and European art. The College, established in 1890, offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs, as well as continuing education courses. Embracing a broad cultural and educational mission, the Corcoran presents, interprets, and preserves the art of our times and times past while training future artists and designers.
organization.description: The Corcoran Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C.'s oldest art museum and only college of art, provides education, exhibition, and outreach programs for diverse constituencies.

organization.name: The HSC Foundation
organization.missionStatement: The HSC Foundation's mission is to facilitate access to appropriate care and services for children with special needs and their families in the Washington, DC metropolitan area while conducting regional and national projects with governmental, private and philanthropic organizations.
organization.description: The HSC Foundation focuses on health care programs that are innovative in the financing, organization and delivery of medical and social services to children with special needs.

organization.name: Building Hope
organization.missionStatement: Building Hope is a private foundation that works to close the educational achievement gap by giving students access to high quality public charter schools.
organization.description: Building Hope helps charter schools overcome facility acquisition barriers by offering technical assistance and financial expertise related to the planning, acquisition, renovation, construction, and maintenance of school facilities.

organization.name: LIFE AND HEALTH BENEFITS PLAN OF THE AMERICAN RED CROSS
THE ALBERT B SABIN VACCINE INSTITUTE INC
organization.missionStatement: The Albert B. Sabin Vaccine Institute is a non-profit public organization dedicated to saving lives by stimulating the development and distribution of vaccines throughout the world. The Institute is committed to continuing the work of Dr. Albert Sabin, who envisioned the enormous potential of vaccines to prevent deadly diseases.
organization.description: Educational and scientific purposes relating to vaccine development, delivery, research and education.

organization.name: Pan American Development Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Pan American Development Foundation empowers disadvantaged people and communities in Latin America and the Caribbean to achieve sustainable economic and social progress, strengthen their communities and civil society, and prepare for and respond to natural disasters and other humanitarian crises, thereby advancing the principles of the Organization of the American States.
organization.description: PADF was founded in 1962 by the Organization of American States to improve the quality of life in Latin America and the Caribbean.

organization.name: Vietnam Veterans of America Foundation
organization.missionStatement: VVAF addresses the causes, conduct and consequences of war through programs of advocacy and service for victims of conflict around the world.<p>
organization.description: Co-founder and coordinator of the 1997 Nobel Peace Prize-winning global landmine campaign. Operates international rehabilitation clinics, landmine awareness programs and conducts mine impact surveys.

organization.name: INTERNATIONAL ASSN OF BRIDGE STRUCTURAL ORNAMENTAL AND
KIPP DC
organization.missionStatement:
Our mission is to create and sustain the highest quality school system for the communitites most under-served in Washington, D.C.
KIPP DC students develop the knowledge, skills, and character necessary to become thoughtful, influential, and successful citizens in the competitive world.
KIPP DC will raise expectations of public education in under-served communities by cultivating high-performing educational leaders and by serving as a model of excellence.
organization.description: KIPP DC is a network of high-performing, college-preparatory charter schools in Washington D.C, which serve the city's most under-resourced communities.

organization.name: BNAI BRITH YOUTH ORGANIZATION INC aka BBYO
organization.missionStatement: BBYO is the leading pluralistic Jewish teen movement in North America aspiring to involve more Jewish teens in more meaningful Jewish experiences. For more than 80 years, AZA and BBG (boys and girls chapters respectively) in communities around the world have been providing exceptional leadership programs and Jewish identity enrichment, shaping the lives of 250,000 alumni who are among the most prominent figures in business, politics, academia, the arts and Jewish communal life. Now, more than ever, BBYO offers innovative opportunities for teens to connect with one another, serve their communities, navigate the college admissions process and travel the world, providing each participant with a network of lifelong friends, a perspective which adds value and meaning to life and a shared commitment toward strengthening the Jewish future.
organization.description: BBYO, now totally independent of B'nai B'rith, is uniquely positioned to strengthen the Jewish future by involving more Jewish teens in more meaningful Jewish experiences through innovative approaches based on the interests of today's teens.

organization.name: Leadership Conference Education Fund, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: LCCREF is a nonprofit public education and research organization that seeks to communicate to the American people about the progress made in civil rights and inter-group relations, the continuing challenges, and the strength of our diversity. Our work champions the idea that Americans of every heritage can live together with equal rights and mutual respect. We provide training and tools for students, parents, and teachers to assist in building a country that actively embraces pluralism and commitment to justice and understanding, and provide up-to-date information on civil rights and social and economic justice issues.
organization.description: LCCREF is a nonprofit public education and research organization that seeks to communicate to the American people about the progress made in civil rights and inter-group relations, the continuing challenges, and the strength of our diversity.

organization.name: IODP MANAGEMENT INTERNATIONAL INC
organization.missionStatement: The Integrated Ocean Drilling Program is an international marine research drilling program dedicated to advancing scientific understanding of the Earth by sampling subseafloor drilling and coring, and establishing lon-term borehole observatories. Hundreds of the world's preeminent scientists explore IODP's principal themes: the deep biosphere, global environmental change, and solid earth cycles.
organization.description: IODP-MI was created as the Central Management Organization to bring together the international scientific ocean drilling research community and is funded by NSF, MEXT, ECORD and MOST.

organization.name: H. John Heinz III Center for Science Economics and the Environment
organization.missionStatement:
Established in December 1995 to carry on the work of Senator John Heinz (1938-1991), The Heinz Center is a nonpartisan, nonprofit institution dedicated to improving the scientific and economic foundation for environmental policy through multisectoral collaboration. The Center fosters collaboration among industry, environmental organizations, academia, and all levels of government in each of its program areas and projects. It uses scientific and economic analyses to develop viable options to solving problems, and its findings and recommendations are widely disseminated to public and private sector decision makers, the scientific community, and the public. The active involvement of high-level decision makers in government and industry, as well as of leading academic researchers and environmental activists enables the Center to make a unique contribution to environmental policymaking.
The Center&#8217;s work currently focuses on three strategic areas: Environmental Reporting; Global Change; and Sustainable Oceans, Coasts, and Waterways.&#160;
organization.description: The Heinz Center is a nonpartisan, nonprofit institution dedicated to improving the scientific and economic foundation for environmental policy through multisectoral collaboration.

organization.name: IRONWORKER MANAGEMENT PROGRESSIVE ACTION COOPERATIVE TRUST
CENTER FOR STRATEGIC AND INTERNATIONAL STUDIES INC
NATIONAL COUNCIL OF ARCHITECTURAL REGISTRATION BOARDS
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF REAL ESTATE INVESTMENTS TRUSTS
NORTH AMERICAN REGION OF THE AIRPORTS COUNCIL INTERNATIONAL
Microfinance Opportunities, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
Microfinance Opportunities is unique in that it focuses on the demand side of microfinance. It occupies a niche role in providing services that directly benefit the end user, the low income consumer of financial services, working to increase poor people's access to and understanding of well-designed and delivered financial services. Access to these services can improve the capacity of households, women and microentrepreneurs to increase their incomes, build assets and reduce their vulnerability.
As the microfinance industry becomes more competitive, the consumer faces an increasing number of options. A greater understanding of the financial services available enables clients to better manage their financial options and economic shocks; to this end, Microfinance Opportunities' work on financial education addresses the information asymmetries faced by clients.
Impact assessment provides insights about how clients interact with and benefit from the provision of financial services. Market research focuses on understanding clients in order to know their needs, identifying gaps in the market and assessing competition.
Overall, Microfinance Opportunities provides support services that complement the product offerings of microfinance institutions and networks, enriching the experience for the end user, linking product use and product demand with product development.
organization.description: Microfinance Opportunities is a market leader in the design and delivery of financial education for the poor in developing countries, market research for microinsurance and the conduct of impact assessment for the microfinance industry.

organization.name: Eno Transportation Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The Eno Transportation Foundation works to improve personal mobility and economic productivity through better understanding of transportation issues. It seeks to maintain a transportation system, at all levels that supports personal mobility, economic growth, and quality of life, including safety and environmental aspects. It's programs focus on emerging issues in transportation -- issues that challenge the capacity of transportation-related organizations, both public and private -- to develop effective solutions. The Foundation compiles statistics on transportation trends, publishes technical reports on major issues, publishes Transportation Quarterly, conducts programs to promote transportation leadership among graduate students in transportation, public transportation officials, metropolitan planners, state transportation officials, and industry personnel. It also conducts policy forums in which the disparate interests affected by transportation policies come together, on neutral ground, to develop shared understanding and seek constructive resolution of issues. The Eno Foundation's programs are independent of any modal, business, or political interest, but frequently done in close cooperation with other professional groups interested in better transportation.
organization.description: The Eno Transportation Foundation was founded by William Phelps Eno in 1921 to bring order and efficiency to transportation operations. It focuses on emerging issues in transportation through its publications, policy forums, and leadership development programs. Current issues include global climate change, intermodal transportation, benefits of mobility, and transportation needs of an aging society.

organization.name: PARTNERS FOR THE COMMON GOOD INC
organization.description: We provide access to debt capital for community based ventures, double bottom line businesses and nonprofits.

organization.name: The American Architectural Foundation, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: The American Architectural Foundation was founded in 1942. Headquartered at the historic Octagon, America's oldest museum devoted to architecture, the American Architectural Foundation envisions a society that understands, appreciates, and participates in the design process; one that recognizes the value of our architectural heritage and advocates architecture as an essential strategy in enhancing a community's quality of life.
organization.description: AAF helps people understand the importance of architecture to enrich lives and transform communities.

organization.name: Foundation for Biomedical Research
organization.missionStatement: FBR has provided over two decades of continuous service to America's research community and is the leading voice of scientific reason and medical progress in the ongoing, sometimes violent debate that surrounds animal research. Through its innovative programs of public information and education, FBR seeks to enlighten the news media, teachers, students and the general public about the essential need for animals in research and their vital role in medical and scientific advancement. It serves as an accessible, reliable resource for the news media and works to bring American journalists and scientists together to promote exceptional and ongoing news coverage that contributes to public appreciation and respect for the humane and responsible use of animals in medical and scientific research.
organization.description: The Foundation for Biomedical Research (FBR) is dedicated to improving human and animal health by promoting public understanding and support for the humane and responsible use of animals in medical and scientific research.

organization.name: US Association for UNHCR
organization.missionStatement: USA for UNHCR is an independent nonprofit organization that provides support for the humanitarian work of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) through fundraising, education, and advocacy. The organization supports refugee protection and relief programs around the world, meeting needs by providing resources to the world's most vulnerable people. USA for UNHCR also informs Americans about the plight of refugees and advocates for refugee awareness and protection.
organization.description: This organization seeks individual contributions and private grants for refugee protection and relief programs around the world.

organization.name: LEON HOWARD SULLIVAN FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement:
The mission of the Leon H. Sullivan Foundation is to preserve and extend the legacy of the Reverend Leon H. Sullivan by providing financial support and advocacy for the following organizations which he founded: Opportunities Industrialization Centers of America (OICA), Opportunities Industrialization Centers International (OICI), and The International Foundation for Education and Self Help (IFESH). The Sullivan Foundation endeavors to advocate on behalf of impoverished people through the promotion of the principles of self-help, social responsibility, and human rights.
The Leon H. Sullivan Foundation and the Sullivan Entities bring together world leaders, decision-makers, experts and the general public in the areas of Agriculture, Business, Culture, Education, Energy, Health, Democracy and Governance in order to highlight key issues and best practices so as to influence policies, develop strategic partnerships, organize conferences and forums and implement sustainable development programs.
organization.description: To continue the critical work of the late Reverend Leon H. Sullivan

organization.name: Women Work the National Network for Women's Employment, Inc.
organization.description: Women Work! is a national nonprofit organization that advances economic justice and equality for women.

organization.name: International Center for Journalists, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
The International Center for Journalists was founded in 1984 as an independent, nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality of journalism worldwide, especially in countries with little or no tradition of an independent press.
ICFJ believes that vigorous, independent media are essential building blocks on which democracy, freedom and human rights must be based. The Center is committed to working with colleagues around the globe to: share journalistic, managerial and technical expertise; provide the latest information on media developments, journalism ethics and professional practices; offer support services relevant to changing needs; and encourage vital and independent media that are professionally, ethically and financially grounded.
organization.description: The International Center for Journalists is dedicated to improving the quality of journalism worldwide, especially in countries with little or no tradition of an independent press.

organization.name: Wildlife Alliance, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
Wildlife Alliance works to protect and preserve wildlife, forests and oceans for future generations.
Our organization trains and supports rangers to protect wildlife and wild habitat in national parks and other protected areas from poachers and rampant deforestation. We also work with law enforcement agencies, customs officials and border guards to recognize and stop wildlife crime.
Wildlife Alliance raises environmental awareness through education, advertising and community outreach and works with communities to alleviate endemic poverty while also protecting biodiversity.
organization.description: Wildlife Alliance provides direct protection to endangered species and preserves wild habitat and natural resources.

organization.name: Business Executives For National Security
organization.missionStatement: To help make America safe and secure.
organization.description: BENS draws on the experience of its business leader members and the successful models of the private sector to develop workable solutions to pressing national security challenges.

organization.name: National Space Society
organization.missionStatement: The National Space Society (NSS) is an independent international, educational, grassroots nonprofit 501(c)3 organization dedicated to the creation of a space faring civilization. The NSS has more than 20,000 members, and 80 chapters in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Australia, Ireland and the United Kingdom. The NSS, founded in 1974 by Wernher von Braun, envisions a day when people will live and work in thriving communities beyond the Earth.
organization.description: The mission of the National Space Society is to promote change in social, technical, economic and political conditions to advance the day when people will live and work in space.

organization.name: VSA ARTS INC
organization.missionStatement: Very Special Arts was founded in 1974 by Jean Kennedy Smith as an affiliate of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts to help people with disabilities develop learning skills, increase independence and improve quality of life through programs in the arts. The organization is grounded in the beliefs that: art is a universal language expressing the perceptions and sensibilities of society; art is an educational process for developing creative talents and skills that may not be realized through traditional teaching methods; and that nowhere are the educational and rehabilitative benefits of the arts more compelling than for people with disabilities.
organization.description: VSA arts, (formerly Very Special Arts) was founded in 1974 by Jean Kennedy Smith as an affiliate of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts to help people with disabilities develop learning skills, increase independence and improve quality of life through arts programs.

organization.name: American Community Partnerships, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: American Community Partnerships (ACP) is a national, nonprofit organization, headquartered in Washington, DC. ACP is dedicated to revitalizing, enriching, and diversifying America's workforce by serving as a partnership builder, program designer, and direct service provider in communities in need throughout the country. ACP leverages local, national, union, and corporate resources in an effort to develop and expand long-term career opportunities, with living wages and benefits, for low-income individuals, welfare recipients and public housing residents. To this end, ACP designs, promotes, and manages innovative job training and economic development initiatives aimed at transitioning individuals into the skilled trades and other high demand, family-sustaining occupations.
organization.description: ACP stimulates economic development and facilitates careers with living wages in low-income communities by initiating, building, and leveraging resources in support of locally-driven training efforts.

organization.name: WELLNESS COMMUNITY-NATIONAL
organization.missionStatement: Through participation in professionally-led support groups, educational workshops and mind/body programs utilizing the Patient Active Concept, people affected by cancer can learn vital skills to regain control, reduce feelings of isolation, and restore hope - regardless of the stage of disease. Most importantly, The Wellness Community provides a home-like setting for people with cancer where they can connect with and learn from each other. At The Wellness Community, all programs are free of charge.

organization.name: TRUST FOR AMERICAS HEALTH
organization.missionStatement: Trust for America's Health's mission is to protect the health and safety of all communities from current and emerging health threats by strengthening the fundamentals of our public health defenses.
organization.description: TFAH is a non-profit organization dedicated to saving lives by protecting the health of every community and working to make disease prevention a national priority.

organization.name: AFTERSCHOOL ALLIANCE
organization.missionStatement:
To engage public will to increase public and private investment in quality afterschool programs at the national, state, and local levels.
Vision: The Afterschool Alliance works to ensure that all youth have access to affordable, quality afterschool programs.
Facts:
&#8226; More than 14 million school age children are on their own after school.
Among them are more than 40,000 kindergarteners.
&#8226; Only 6.5 million K-12 children participate in afterschool programs.&#160;
An additional 15 million would participate if a quality program were available in their community.
organization.description: We work to ensure that all children have access to quality afterschool programs.

organization.name: National Organization on Disability
organization.description: The mission of the National Organization on disability is to expand the participation and contribution of Americays 54 million men, women and children with disabilities in all aspects of life.

organization.name: U S-UKRAINE FOUNDATION
organization.missionStatement: The Foundation creates and sustains channels of communication between the United States and Ukraine for the purpose of Building Peace and Prosperity Through Shared Democratic Values. USUF is dedicated to strengthening the mutual objectives of both nations while advancing Ukraine as a cornerstone of regional stability and as a full partner in the community of nations.
organization.description: The U.S.-Ukraine Foundation facilitates democratic development, encourages free market reform, and enhances human rights in Ukraine.

organization.name: National Society of the Children of the American Revolution
organization.missionStatement: The N.S.C.A.R., founded in 1895, is the oldest patriotic youth organization in the U.S. Membership is open to descendants of patriots of the American Revolution. The age range of members is birth to twenty-one, with meetings and special activities planned for all ages. Members gain invaluable leadership experience in conducting meetings, following parliamentary procedures and standard protocol, serving as delegates and speaking before groups at local, state, and national conferences. The responsibility and privilege of selecting officers helps members gain an understanding of the democratic process.
organization.description: The N.S.C.A.R. trains good citizens, develops leaders, and promotes love of the United States of America and its heritage among young people.

organization.name: Co-op America
organization.missionStatement: We work for a world where all people have enough, where all communities are healthy and safe, and where the bounty of the Earth is preserved for all the generations to come. We work on issues of social justice and environmental responsibility. We see these issues as completely linked in the quest for a sustainable world - it&#8217;s what we mean when we say &#8220;green.&#8221; We focus on economic strategies - economic action to solve social and environmental problems. We mobilize people in their economic roles - as consumers, investors, workers, and business leaders. We empower people to take personal and collective action. We work to stop abusive practices and to create healthy, just and sustainable practices.
organization.description: Co-op America works with consumers, investors, and businesses to create a socially just and environmentally sustainable world preserved for all generations to come.

organization.name: Center for Public Integrity
organization.missionStatement: The Center's books and reports combine political science and investigative reporting, unfettered by the usual time and space constraints. By providing thorough, thoughtful and objective analyses, the Center hopes to serve as an honest broker of information -- and to inspire a better-informed citizenry to demand a higher level of accountability from its government and elected leaders.
organization.description: The Center for Public Integrity conducts investigations that explore the interaction between private interests and government officials, and its effect on public policy.

organization.name: The Advocacy Institute
organization.missionStatement:
The Advocacy Institute works to make social justice leadership strategic, effective, and sustainable in pursuit of a just world.
The Advocacy Institute makes a difference by strengthening leadership and movements for political, social, and economic justice. Working with our partners to help make democratic institutions accountable, our work links us with a global community of grassroots activists and NGO leaders tackling critical human rights issues -- such as ending poverty, public health, gender equity, peace, community development, and preserving the environment.
organization.description: The Advocacy Institute's work includes: leadership development, advocacy skills training, movement building, strategy development, facilitating alliance building, strategic counseling, and networking of advocates.

organization.name: Persephone Productions, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: PPI produces the PBS women's news analysis program, To the Contrary, which airs nationally on 230 PBS stations before an audience of one million viewers each week. We were recently called the the Associated Press the only program on national television that gives women (including women of color) a platform to express a variety of fascinating and well-informed views on the major issues of the day---in other words, to portray women as opinion leaders. We address issues that particularly affect women, children and families from a public policy perspective such a day care, Social Security reform, women in politics, women in business, women & the glass ceiling, education reform, women's health, etc. We balance the show politically as well as racially, so the viewpoints of women of all political persuasions and ethnic backgrounds are fairly represented. We are an alternative to the Sunday morning talk shows such as "This Week" on ABC or Fox News Sumday which focus on a very limited number of topics and whose panelists do not represent the broad spectrum that is America.
organization.description: Informing and improving society's view of women, children, families and communities of color. We want to partner with donors who are seeking national exposure for issues affecting women, children, families and communities of color in a positive media setting.

organization.description: The Alliance's promotes public/private sector biomedical research into aging in order to improve the health, independence and quality of life for all aging Americans.

LA LECHE LEAGUE INTERNATIONAL INC
organization.missionStatement: To help mothers worldwide to breastfeed through mother-to-mother support, encouragement, information and education, and to promote a better understanding of breastfeeding as an important element in the healthy development of the baby and the mother. <p>Statistics<ul><li>LLLI provides over $33 million per year of in-kind services. LLLI reaches well over 300,000 people in 63 countries every month. Approximately 39,000 Leaders have been accredited in the past 44 years. Each LLL Group is attended by an average of 10 women per month, with many Groups attracting 20-30 mothers. LLLI's Center for Breastfeeding Information (CBI) contains more than 17,000 full-length research studies with more than 300 categories of breastfeeding data and adds over 125 new studies a month. The LLLI Board of Directors includes members from six countries.</li><li>7 LLLI maintains consultative status with the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), official working relations with the World Health Organization (WHO), acts as a registered Private Voluntary Organization (PVO) for the Agency of International Development (USAID), is an accredited member of the US Healthy Mothers/Healthy Babies Coalition, and is a founding member of the World Alliance for Breastfeeding Action (WABA)</li><li>LLLI is a member of the Child Survival Collaborations and Resources Group (CORE).</li></ul></p>
organization.description: Founded in 1956 by seven women who had learned about successful breastfeeding while nursing their own babies, La Leche League is the only organization with the sole purpose of helping breastfeeding mothers.

organization.name: Neurofibromatosis Clinics Associates, Inc.
organization.missionStatement:
The NFCA began organizing in 1993 with the principal goal of providing support for the people afflicted with NF, and their families, in Pittsburgh and the surrounding region. The support was to come via social gatherings, phone support, education regarding NF and referral to the NF clinic in the Pittsburgh area. In addition, the NFCA recognized that extensive research was required to find prevention of and/or a cure for NF.
In order to support their programs, the NFCA initiated fundraisers. The first two were a day of Sports & Blues and a 5K Walk-a-Long. The efforts of a small group of volunteers culminated in successful events that continue annually and together have increased 50% in net profit. These, in addition to a style show fundraiser, have served to fund printing of educational brochures, production of a video, and sponsorship of an educational symposium to update professionals, students, and NF families on NF status.
The volunteer effort for these events has grown to include representatives from three local universities and the Army Reserve, involvement that also serves to educate the public on NF. Excellent education is also provided by more NF oriented volunteers who speak to 1st year medical students at the University of Pittsburgh annually and are available to speak at schools, agencies, and organizations that are interested in learning about the disorder.
The obvious support needs of the NF community, the involvement of the Human Genetics Department and several neurologists at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center in an NF clinic, and the doctors recognition of the NFCA as an impact group, encouraged the NFCA to apply for non-profit exempt status in the fall of 1993. By 1995, membership requirements and by-laws were established, Articles of Incorporation were written, the first annual meeting was held and, finally, non-profit status was attained.
Another giant step was taken when a golf tournament was sponsored for the purpose of funding social workers. The first tournament was held in 1996, continues annually, and has funded social workers since January of 1997. These social workers participate in all NF events to make themselves available to the community and meet privately with those who choose to do so.
organization.description: The Neurofibromatosis Clinics Association is a non-profit organization dedicated to serving people with Neurofibromatosis (a common genetic disorder affecting the nervous system)and their families.

National Public Radio, Inc.
organization.missionStatement: Established in 1970, National Public Radio (NPR) is the nation's foremost producer and distributor of programming for the nation's public radio system. NPR's mission is to work in partnership with member stations to create a more informed public-one challenged and invigorated by a deeper understanding and appreciation of events, ideas and cultures. To accomplish our mission, NPR produces, acquires and distributes programming that meets the highest standards of public service in journalism and cultural expression. Our vision is to serve the public as the leading provider of high quality news, information and cultural programming worldwide.

Hillel actively seeks to engage uninvolved Jewish students on their own terms: to provide Jewish opportunities that are meaningful and appealing to them.
